arroro: <entryFree id="n3759" type="main" key="arro_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ar-rōro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n3759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bedew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbam vino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arrosor: <entryFree id="n3760" type="hapax" key="arro_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrōsor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>arrodo</etym>, <sense id="n3760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who gnaws at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consumes</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">a nibbler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consumer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultorum divitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arrosus: <entryFree id="n3761" type="main" key="arro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of arrodo.</entryFree>
arrotans: <entryFree id="n3762" type="main" key="arro^tans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ar-rŏtans</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adr-</orth>), <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>qs. <mood>Part.</mood> of arroto, āre; rota</etym>, <sense id="n3762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a winding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circular motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turning</hi>, trop. <hi rend="ital">wavering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrotanti tactu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arrotrebae: <entryFree id="n3763" type="main" key="Arro_^tre^bae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arrō^trĕbae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory in</hi> Hispania, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 20, 34, § 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arrubium: <entryFree id="n3764" type="main" key="Arru^bi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arrŭbĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n3764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the Danubius in</hi> Scythia Minor, Tab. Peut. Itin.</sense></entryFree>
arrugia: <entryFree id="n3765" type="main" key="arru_gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrūgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>akin to runco, runcina, <foreign lang="greek">o)ru/ssw, o)ru/cw</foreign>, to dig; cf. Corssen, Ausspr. I. p. 543; v. corrugus</etym>, <sense id="n3765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaft and pit in a gold-mine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arruns: <entryFree id="n3766" type="main" key="Arruns"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arruns</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Aruns.</entryFree>
arruntius: <entryFree id="n3767" type="main" key="Arrunti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arruntĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman</hi> nomen. </sense><sense id="n3767.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Arruntius, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A.U.C. 759, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">prob. the same as the historian L. Arruntius, who composed a work on the Punic Wars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 17</bibl></cit> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n3767.2" n="II" level="1"> Arruntius, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated artist under Claudius Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n3767.3" n="III" level="1"> Arruntius Stella, <hi rend="ital">a poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:21" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3767.4" n="IV" level="1"> Arruntius Caelius, <hi rend="ital">a Latin grammarian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> I. p. 307</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> III. p. 607</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
arruo: <entryFree id="n3768" type="main" key="arru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arrŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. adruo.</entryFree>
ars: <entryFree id="n3769" type="main" key="ars"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ars</orth>, <itype>artis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>v. arma</etym>, <sense id="n3769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">skill in joining something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">working it</hi>, etc., with the advancement of Roman culture, carried entirely beyond the sphere of the common pursuits of life, into that of artistic and scientific action, just as, on the other hand, in mental cultivation, skill is applied to morals, designating character, manner of thinking, so far as it is made known by external actions (syn.: doctrina, sollertia, calliditas, prudentia, virtus, industria, ratio, via, dolus). </sense><sense id="n3769.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Skill in producing any material form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handicraft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupation</hi>, <cb n="ARS" /> <hi rend="ital">employment</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">te/xnh</foreign>). </sense><sense id="n3769.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zeno censet artis proprium esse creare et gignere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 22, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (artium) omne opus est in faciendo atque agendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:12 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 3, 12 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3769.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3769.4" n="1" level="3"> With the idea extended, <hi rend="ital">any physical</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mental activity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so far as it is practically exhibited; a profession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">art</hi> (<hi rend="ital">music</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poetry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">medicine</hi>, etc.); acc. to Roman notions, the arts were either liberales or ingenuae artes, arts of freemen, the liberal arts; or artes illiberales or sordidae, the arts, employments, of slaves or the lower classes. </sense><sense id="n3769.5" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Eleus Hippias gloriatus est nihil esse ullā in arte rerum omnium, quod ipse nesciret: nec solum has artes, quibus liberales doctrinae atque ingenuae continerentur, geometriam, musicam, litterarum cognitionem et poëtarum, atque illa, quae de naturis rerum, quae de hominum moribus, quae de rebus publicis dicerentur, sed anulum, quem haberet, pallium, quo amictus, soccos, quibus indutus esset, se suā manu confecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jam de artificiis et quaestibus, qui liberales habendi, qui sordidi sint, haec fere accepimus. Primum improbantur ii quaestus, qui in odia hominum incurrunt, ut portitorum, ut feneratorum. Illiberales autem et sordidi quaestus mercenariorum omniumque, quorum operae, non artes emuntur: est enim in illis ipsa merces auctoramentum servitutis ... Opificesque omnes in sordidā arte versantur ... Quibus autem artibus aut prudentia major inest aut non mediocris utilitas quaeritur, ut medicina, ut architectura, ut doctrina rerum honestarum, hae sunt iis, quorum ordini conveniunt, honestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes elegantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:32" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leviores artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediocres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis artifex omnis artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:18:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 18, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifices omnium artium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:22:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Par. 22, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3769.6" n="b" level="4"> Esp., of a single art, and, </sense><sense id="n3769.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With an <pos>adj.</pos> designating it: <cit><quote lang="la">ars gymnastica,</quote> <trans><tr>gymnastics</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars duellica,</quote> <trans><tr>the art of war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars imperatoria,</quote> <trans><tr>generalship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(artes) militares et imperatoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes civiles,</quote> <trans><tr>politics</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes urbanae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>jurisprudence and eloquence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars grammatica,</quote> <trans><tr>grammar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 39, 40, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetorica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musica,</quote> <trans><tr>poetry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:prol. 23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. prol. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musica,</quote> <trans><tr>music</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 23, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicae artes,</quote> <trans><tr>the healing art</tr>, <tr>medicine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 145</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ars Apollinea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 493</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 17, 7</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">maleficis artibus inserviebat,</quote> <trans><tr>he used witchcraft</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 33, 6</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n3769.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> designating it: <cit><quote lang="la">ars disserendi,</quote> <trans><tr>dialectics</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars dicendi,</quote> <trans><tr>the art of speaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 107</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 17</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ars eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars medendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 735</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars medentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:158" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicorum ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 16, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigmentariorum ars,</quote> <trans><tr>the art of unguents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars armorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the art of war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars pugnae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 5, 27</bibl></cit>; so in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars gubernandi,</quote> <trans><tr>navigation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 33</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ars gubernatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 42</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes the kind of art may be distinguished by the connection, so that ars is used <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> of a particular art: <cit><quote lang="la">instruere Atriden num potes arte meā? i. e. arte sagittandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc ego sim Inachio notior arte Lino, i. e. arte canendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:4:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fert ingens a puppe Notus: nunc arte (sc. navigandi) relictā Ingemit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:29" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 29</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:715" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 715</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imus ad insignes Urbis ab arte (sc. rhetoricā) viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusdem erat artis, i. e. artis scaenofactoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 18, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3769.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Science</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knowledge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis ignorat, ii, qui mathematici vocantur, quantā in obscuritate rerum et quam reconditā in arte et multiplici subtilique versentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam si ars ita definitur, ex rebus penitus perspectis planeque cognitis atque ab opinionis arbitrio sejunctis, scientiāque comprehensis, non mihi videtur ars oratoris esse ulla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 108</bibl></cit>: nihil est quod ad artem redigi possit, nisi ille prius, qui illa tenet. quorum artem instituere vult, habeat illam scientiam (sc. dialecticam),<cb n="ARS" />  ut ex iis rebus, quarum ars nondum sit, artem efficere possit, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41, 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars juris civilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Antiochus) negabat ullam esse artem, quae ipsa a se proficisceretur. Etenim semper illud extra est, quod arte comprehenditur ... Est enim perspicuum nullam artem ipsam in se versari, sed esse aliud artem ipsam, aliud, quod propositum sit arti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:30:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 30, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir bonus optimisque artibus eruditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: ingenium docile, come, ap-tum ad artes optimas, id. Dion, 1, 2 al.—</sense><sense id="n3769.10" n="C" level="2"> </sense><sense id="n3769.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The theory of any art</hi> or <hi rend="ital">science</hi>: ars est praeceptio, quae dat certam viam rationemque faciendi aliquid, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Asper, p. 1725 P.: non omnia, quaecumque loquimur, mihi videntur ad artem et ad praecepta esse revocanda,</quote> <trans><tr>not every thing is to be traced back to theory and rules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:11:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 11, 44</bibl></cit>: res mihi videtur esse facultate (<hi rend="ital">in practice</hi>) praeclara, arte (<hi rend="ital">in theory</hi>) mediocris; <cit><quote lang="la">ars enim earum rerum est, quae sciuntur: oratoris autem omnis actio opinionibus, non scientiā continetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 22</bibl>.—In later Lat. ars is used, </sense><sense id="n3769.12" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> for <hi rend="ital">grammatical analysis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grammar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curru non, ut quidam putant, pro currui posuit, nec est apocope: sed ratio artis antiquae, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 156</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 95</bibl>: et hoc est artis, ut (vulgus) masculino utamur, quia omnia Latina nomina in <hi rend="ital">us</hi> exeuntia, si neutra fuerint, tertiae sunt declinationis, etc., id. ad eund. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 149</bibl>: secundum artem dicamus honor, arbor, lepor: plerumque poëtae <hi rend="ital">r</hi> in <hi rend="ital">s</hi> mutant, id. ad eund. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 153 al.</bibl>—Hence also, </sense><sense id="n3769.13" n="b" level="4"> As a title of books in which such theories are discussed, for <hi rend="ital">rhetorical</hi> and, at a later period, for <hi rend="ital">grammatical treatises.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3769.14" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Rhetorical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam multa non solum praecepta in artibus, sed etiam exempla in orationibus bene dicendi reliquerunt!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsae rhetorum artes, quae sunt totae forenses atque populares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: neque eo dico, quod ejus (Hermagorae) ars mihi mendosissime scripta videatur; nam satis in eā videtur ex antiquis artibus (<hi rend="ital">from the ancient works on rhetoric</hi>) ingeniose et diligenter electas res collocāsse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi verbis et artibus aluerunt naturae principia, hi autem institutis et legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem scindens Theodori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:177" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 177</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3769.15" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Grammar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in artibus legimus superlativum gradum non nisi genitivo plurali jungi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 96</bibl></cit>: ut in artibus lectum est, id. ad eund. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 535</bibl>.—So Ars, as the title of the later Lat. grammars: <hi rend="ital">Donati Ars Grammatica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cledonii Ars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Marii Victorini Ars</hi>, etc.; v. the grammarians in Gothofred., Putsch., Lindem., Keil.—</sense><sense id="n3769.16" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The knowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">art</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">workmanship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employed in effecting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">working upon an object</hi> (Fr. <hi rend="ital">adresse</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">majore quādam opus est vel arte vel diligentiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tripodas septem pondere et arte pares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 32</bibl></cit>: qui canit arte, canat; <cit><quote lang="la">qui bibit arte, bibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arte laboratae vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plausus tunc arte carebat,</quote> <trans><tr>was void of art</tr>, <tr>was natural</tr>, <tr>unaffected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 113</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n3769.17" n="3" level="3"> (Concr.) <hi rend="ital">The object artistically formed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a work of art</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum efferri jussit Didymaonis artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divite me scilicet artium, Quas aut Parrhasius protulit aut Scopas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3769.18" n="4" level="3"> Artes (personified), <hi rend="ital">the Muses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">artium chorus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, prol. 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3769.19" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> from mind to morals, <hi rend="ital">the moral character of a man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so far as it is made known by actions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner of acting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practice</hi>, whether good or bad: <cit><quote lang="la">si in te aegrotant artes antiquae tuae,</quote> <trans><tr>your former manner of life</tr>, <tr>conduct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 6</bibl> Lind.: <cit><quote lang="la">nempe tuā arte viginti minae Pro psaltriā periere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est, Quod tibi mea ars efficere hoc possit amplius?</quote> <trans><tr>my assiduity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hac arte (i. e. constantiā, perseverantiā) Pollux et vagus Hercules Enisus arces attigit igneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae sunt artes (i. e. virtutes) eximiae, hujus administrae comitesque virtutis (sc. imperatoris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 37</bibl> Zumpt: <cit><quote lang="la">nam imperium facile his artibus retinetur, quibus initio partum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 4</bibl></cit> Kritz; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultusque artesque virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores quoque confer et artes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 713</bibl></cit>: praeclari facinoris aut artis <pb n="167" /> <cb n="ARTA" /> bonae famam quaerere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 9</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus insolens malarum artium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 57</bibl>.—Hence also, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> in mal. part. as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/xnh</foreign> for <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stratagem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec arte tractabat virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 125</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 142</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">capti eādem arte sunt, quā ceperant Fabios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at Cytherea novas artes, nova pectore versat Consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 657</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 477</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille dolis instructus et arte Pelasgā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talibus insidiis perjurique arte Sinonis Credita res, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudes innectere ponto Antiquā parat arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum illi vel ingenii vel artis vel fortunae superfuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam arte simulantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:20:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 20, 32</bibl></cit>: regem summis artibus pellexit, <foreign lang="greek">pa/sh| mhxanh=|</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arsaces: <entryFree id="n3770" type="main" key="Arsa^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arsăces</orth>, is <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arsa/khs</foreign>, <sense id="n3770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first king of the Parthians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3770.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n3770.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arsăcĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> Arsacidūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 51</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">successors of Arsaces</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:217" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:306 al" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 306 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3770.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arsăcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Arsacian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Parthian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:36" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arsamosata: <entryFree id="n3771" type="main" key="Arsamo^sa^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arsamŏsăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Armosata.</entryFree>
arseverse: <entryFree id="n3772" type="main" key="arse verse"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arse verse</orth>, <sense id="n3772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Tuscan-Latin incantation against fire</hi>: ARSE VERSE averte ignem significat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 18</bibl> Müll. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 20</bibl>). A pure Tuscan inscr. found at Cortona with this formula reads: <cit><quote lang="la">ARSES. VVRSES. SETHLANL., etc., i. e. Ignem averte, Vulcane,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1384</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arsella: <entryFree id="n3773" type="main" key="arsella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arsella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> argemonia, q. v., <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arsenaria: <entryFree id="n3774" type="main" key="Arse_na_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arsēnārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman colony in</hi> Mauretania Caesariensis, now <hi rend="ital">Arzew</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 1, § 19</bibl>; it is called <hi rend="ital">Arsinna</hi> in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:6:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 6, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arsenicum: <entryFree id="n3775" type="main" key="arse^ni^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arsĕnĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. arrenicum.</entryFree>
arsenogonon: <entryFree id="n3776" type="main" key="arse^no^go^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arsĕnŏgŏnon</orth>, v. arrhenogonon.</entryFree>
arsia: <entryFree id="n3777" type="main" key="Arsi^a1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river of Istria</hi>, which became the boundary between Italy and Illyricum under Augustus; the present <hi rend="ital">Arsa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 29, § 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 5</bibl>; cf. Mann. Thrace, p. 325.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3778" type="main" key="Arsi^a2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arsĭa Silva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forestin Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for a battle between the Tarquinii and the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8</bibl>; cf. Nieb. Röm. Gesch. 1, 553.</sense></entryFree>
arsineum: <entryFree id="n3779" type="hapax" key="arsine^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arsinĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n3779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woman's headdress</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 20</bibl> Müll.; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=265" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 265</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
arsinna: <entryFree id="n3780" type="main" key="Arsinna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arsinna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Arsenaria.</entryFree>
arsinoe: <entryFree id="n3781" type="main" key="Arsi^no^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Arsĭnŏē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arsĭnŏa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arsino/h</foreign>. <sense id="n3781.0" n="I" level="1"> Arsinoa, <hi rend="ital">mother of the third Mercury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3781.1" n="II" level="1"> Arsinoë, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Ptolemy Lagus and Berenice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of king Lysimachus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards of her brother Ptolemy Philadelphus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2" default="NO">17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:2" default="NO">24, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arsĭnŏēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the monument erected to her by the latter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 9, 14, § 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3781.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Lysimachus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the first wife of Ptolemy Philadelphus; after her death worshipped as</hi> Venus Zephyritis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 42, § 148</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3781.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Ptolemy Auletes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister of Cleopatra</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 4 and 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 521</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3781.4" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Hyades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 182" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 182</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3781.5" n="VI" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of several towns</hi>, </sense><sense id="n3781.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Lower Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 11, § 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3781.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Cyrenaica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:7" default="NO">3, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 1</bibl>, c.—</sense><sense id="n3781.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Cilicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 92</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Arsĭnŏē-tĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Ar-sinoe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 47, § 165</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3781.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A town on the north side of Cyprus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arsis: <entryFree id="n3782" type="greek" key="arsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/rsis</foreign>, in metre, <sense id="n3782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the elevation of the voice;</hi> opp. thesis, depression (in pure Lat., sublatio, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 471</bibl> P.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, p. 328</bibl>; Don. p. 1738 P.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2412" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2412</bibl> P., and Mar. Vict. p. 2482 P.</sense></entryFree>
arsus: <entryFree id="n3783" type="main" key="arsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of ardeo.</entryFree>
artaba: <entryFree id="n3784" type="foreign" key="arta^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artăba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Egyptian dry measure</hi> = 3 1/3 Rom. modii, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rhem. Fan.</author> Pond. 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
artabanus: <entryFree id="n3785" type="main" key="Arta^ba_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Artăbānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n3785.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Parthian king of the family of the Arsacidœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 31</bibl> sq.; 11, 8.—</sense><sense id="n3785.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A general of Xerxes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
artacie: <entryFree id="n3786" type="main" key="Arta^ci^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Artăcĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)artaki/h</foreign> (Hom. Od. 10, 108), <sense id="n3786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain in the country of the Lœstrygones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:60" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
artatus: <entryFree id="n3787" type="main" key="arta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artātus</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">arct-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from arto.</entryFree>
artaxata: <entryFree id="n3788" type="main" key="Artaxa^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Artaxăta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Artaxăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <cb n="ARTI" /> <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 56</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*)arta/cata</foreign>, <sense id="n3788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital of Armenia Major</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Araxes</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ardaschad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:170" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
artaxerxes: <entryFree id="n3789" type="main" key="Artaxerxes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Artaxerxes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)artace/rchs</foreign>, <sense id="n3789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several Persian kings</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:3 al" default="NO">10, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
arte: <entryFree id="n3790" type="main" key="arte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artē</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">arctē</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. artus <sense id="n3790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
artemis: <entryFree id="n3791" type="main" key="Arte^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Artĕmis</orth>, <itype>idis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/artemis</foreign>, <sense id="n3791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Greek name of Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 36, § 73</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
artemisia: <entryFree id="n3792" type="main" key="Arte^mi^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Artĕmĭsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/artemisi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n3792.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Wife of King Mausolus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Caria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after his death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she built the renowned Mausoleum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3792.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">artĕmĭsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the plant mugwort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 36, § 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
artemisium: <entryFree id="n3793" type="main" key="Arte^misi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Artĕmisĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)artemi/sion</foreign>. <sense id="n3793.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A promontory of the island Eubœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 3, 2</bibl> and 4.—</sense><sense id="n3793.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Eubœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4</bibl>. 12, 21, § 64.</sense></entryFree>
artemita: <entryFree id="n3794" type="main" key="Arte^mi^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Artĕmĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Artĕmĭtē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)arte/mita</foreign>. <sense id="n3794.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Assyria</hi> or, perh. more strictly, <hi rend="ital">of Babylonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 117</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3794.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another name for Rhene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Echinades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 22, § 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
artemon: <entryFree id="n3795" type="greek" key="arte^mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artĕmon</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">artĕmo</orth>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 99</bibl> P.), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rte/mwn</foreign>. <sense id="n3795.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sail put upon the mast above the main-sail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a top-sail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:242" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 242</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 27, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3795.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The guiding-pulley of a machine for raising weights</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arteria: <entryFree id="n3796" type="greek" key="arte_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artērĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">artērĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n3796.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), = <foreign lang="greek">a)rthri/a</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n3796.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The windpipe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arteria ad pulmonem atque cor pertinens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 66, § 175</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:49" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 6, 22, § 49</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 66, § 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:11:2 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 11, 2 al.</bibl>—From its internal roughness, also called arteria aspera (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">traxei=a a)rthri/a</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum aspera arteria (sic enim a medicis appellatur) ostium habeat adjunctum linguae radicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.—And since it consists of two parts, also in the <number>plur.</number>: laeduntur arteriae, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arteriae reticendo acquiescunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 48, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:26:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 26, 9</bibl>.—Once in the <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">artērĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 529</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n3796.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An artery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis per venas in omne corpus diffunditur et spiritus per arterias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 138</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">arteriarum pulsus citatus aut tardus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 88, § 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arteria incisa non coit neque sanescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes it interchanges with vena; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:10:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 10, 4 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
arteriace: <entryFree id="n3797" type="greek" key="arte_ri^a^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artērĭăcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rthriakh/</foreign>, <sense id="n3797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicine for the windpipe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 71, § 136</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 25, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 74" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 74</bibl> and 75.</sense></entryFree>
arteriacus: <entryFree id="n3798" type="greek" key="arte_ri^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artērĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rthriako/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the windpipe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta,</quote> <trans><tr>that produce coughing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
arteriotomia: <entryFree id="n3799" type="greek" key="arte_ri^o^to^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artērĭŏtŏmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rthriotomi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n3799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an opening</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incision in an artery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
arthriticus: <entryFree id="n3800" type="greek" key="arthri_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arthrītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rqritiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gouty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arthritic</hi>: cocus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
arthritis: <entryFree id="n3801" type="greek" key="arthri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">arthrītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)rqri=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n3801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lameness in the joints</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gout</hi> (in pure Lat., articularis morbus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
articulamentum: <entryFree id="n3802" type="main" key="arti^cu^la_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artĭcŭlāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>articulo</etym>, <sense id="n3802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the articulation of the limbs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a joint</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 214" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 214</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:206" default="NO">206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:263" default="NO">263</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
articularis: <entryFree id="n3803" type="main" key="arti^cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artĭcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>articulus</etym>. <sense id="n3803.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to the joints</hi> (v. articulus, I.): <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <trans><tr>gout</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 73, § 195</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 101" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 101</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3803.1" n="II" level="1"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">like the article</hi> (v. articulus, II. A. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">pronomen, i. e. hic, iste,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 938</bibl></cit> P.; 574 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> p. 1785</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
articularius: <entryFree id="n3804" type="main" key="arti^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the joints</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <trans><tr>gout</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23</bibl> prooem.; 22, 13, 15, § 34.</sense></entryFree>
articulate: <entryFree id="n3805" type="main" key="arti^cu^la_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artĭcŭlātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. articulo, <sense id="n3805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
articulatim: <entryFree id="n3806" type="main" key="arti^cu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artĭcŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>articulatus</etym>. <sense id="n3806.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Joint by joint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limb by limb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piecemeal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem concidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 52</bibl></cit>: membra (pueri) articulatim dividit, poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:26:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 26, 67</bibl>; cf. Planck, Eur. Medea, p. 102: comminuere articulatim diem, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3806.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse, <hi rend="ital">properly divided</hi> (v. articulus, II. A.); hence, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">point by point</hi>: verba discernere articulatim, Lucr. <cb n="ARTI" /> 4, 555: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid explicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:4:179" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, 4, 179</bibl></cit>: aliquid articulatim distincteque dicere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
articulatio: <entryFree id="n3807" type="main" key="arti^cu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artĭcŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>articulo</etym> (belonging to the lang. of the vineyard). <sense id="n3807.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The putting forth of new joints</hi> or <hi rend="ital">knots</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 41, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:163" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 21, 35, § 163</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3807.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A disease of the vine at the joints of the tendrils</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 226</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
articulatus: <entryFree id="n3808" type="main" key="arti^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from articulo.</entryFree>
articulo: <entryFree id="n3809" type="main" key="arti^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artĭcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>articulus</etym>, lit. <sense id="n3809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to divide into single members</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joints;</hi> used only trop. of discourse, <hi rend="ital">to utter distinctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to articulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasce voces mobilis articulat verborum daedala lingua,</quote> <trans><tr>the nimble tongue articulates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 12, p. 349, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 111</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">artĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi>, prop., furnished with joints; hence <hi rend="ital">distinct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba, Sol. c. 65: vox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 217</bibl></cit>, and in gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">articulata (vox) est, quae coartata, hoc est copulata, cum aliquo sensu mentis ejus, qui loquitur, profertur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 537</bibl></cit> P.; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 14</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">artĭcŭlātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">articulately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:9:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
articulosus: <entryFree id="n3810" type="main" key="arti^cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artĭcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of joints</hi>, or (of plants) <hi rend="ital">full of knots</hi> (v. articulus, I.). </sense><sense id="n3810.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 93, § 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3810.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse (v. articulus, II. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitanda concisa nimium et velut articulosa partitio,</quote> <trans><tr>full of minute divisions and subdivisions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 24</bibl></cit> (cf. just before: divisio in digitos diducta).</sense></entryFree>
articulus: <entryFree id="n3811" type="main" key="arti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. artus</etym>, <sense id="n3811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small member connecting various parts of the body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a joint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knuckle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3811.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodi corporum, qui vocantur articuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 88, § 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis digiti articulos habent ternos, pollex binos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 43, 99, § 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summus caudae articulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:153 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 41, 63, § 153 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura sine nodis articulisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipso in articulo, quo jungitur capiti cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxerat articulos macies,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>had made more joints</tr>, <tr>had made the bones visible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:807" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 807</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">articulorum dolores habere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>gouty pains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18</bibl>: postquam illi justa cheragra Contudit articulos, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:58" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatorem vehementis impetus excipit adversarii mollis articulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, molli articulo tractare aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to touch one gently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">softly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 70</bibl>.—Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">ineunte vere in iis (vitibus), quae relicta sunt, exsistit, tamquam ad articulos sarmentorum, ea quae gemma dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 24, 36, § 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante quam seges in articulum eat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 11, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 45, § 159</bibl>. —Of mountains, <hi rend="ital">a hill connecting several larger mountains</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montium articuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 77, § 201</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3811.2" n="B" level="2"> With an extension of the idea, <hi rend="ital">a limb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">member</hi>, in gen. (cf. 2. artus), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 697</bibl>.—Hence also for <hi rend="ital">a finger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34:80" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34, 80</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot manus atteruntur, ut unus niteat articulus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 63, 63, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eo missus est articulus manūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspiciebat articulos manūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: erexit me super articulos manuum mearum, <hi rend="ital">on the fingers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">palms of my hands</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 10, 10</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n3811.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3811.4" n="A" level="2"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">a member</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">division</hi>: articulus dicitur, cum singula verba intervallis distinguuntur caesā oratione, hoc modo: acrimoniā, voce, vultu adversarios perterruisti, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 19</bibl>: continuatio verborum soluta multo est aptior atque jucundior, si est articulis membrisque (<foreign lang="greek">ko/mmasi kai\ kw/lois</foreign>) distincta, quam si continuata ac producta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 186</bibl>: (genus orationis) fluctuans et dissolutum eo quod sine nervis et articulis fluctuat huc et illuc, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 11</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence,</quote> <trans><tr>a short clause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also,</quote> <trans><tr>a single word</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 35, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">articulus Est praesentis temporis demonstrationem continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:35" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 34, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc articulo Quisque omnes significantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:29" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 28, 5, 29</bibl></cit>.—In gram. the <hi rend="ital">pronn.</hi> hic and quis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 45</bibl> Müll.; <hi rend="ital">the article</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3811.5" n="B" level="2"> Of time. </sense><sense id="n3811.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A point of time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a moment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoditatis omnes articulos scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.—With tempus: <cit><quote lang="la">qui hunc in summas angustias adductum putaret, ut eum suis conditionibus in ipso articulo temporis astringeret,</quote> <trans><tr>at the most critical moment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Quinct. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipsis quos dixi temporum articulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 97, 99, § 216</bibl></cit>: si de singulis articulis <pb n="168" /> <cb n="ARTI" /> temporum deliberabimus, August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also without tempus: in ipso articulo,</quote> <trans><tr>at the fit moment</tr>, <tr>at the nick of time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—With dies: <cit><quote lang="la">in articulo diei illius ingressus est,</quote> <trans><tr>on that very day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 7, 13</bibl></cit>.—And with res: <cit><quote lang="la">in articulo rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>; also in articulo, <hi rend="ital">instantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>, = statim, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 33, 3</bibl>.—Hence with the idea extended, </sense><sense id="n3811.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A space</hi>, <hi rend="ital">division of time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi cardines singulis articulis dividuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 59, § 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">octo articuli lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 35, 79, § 350</bibl></cit>: articulus austrinus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in which</hi> auster <hi rend="ital">blows</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3811.8" n="C" level="2"> Of other abstract things, <hi rend="ital">part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">division</hi>, <hi rend="ital">point</hi>: per eosdem articulos (i.e. per easdem honorum partes) et gradus producere, August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationes in mediis latitudinum articulis, quae vocant ecliptica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 15, 13, § 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventum est ergo ad ipsum articulum causae, i. e. ventum ad rei cardinem,</quote> <trans><tr>the turning-point</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 243</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
artifex: <entryFree id="n3812" type="main" key="arti^fex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">artĭfex</orth>, <itype>fĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ars-facio</etym>. <sense id="n3812.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n3812.1" n="A. 1." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One that is master in the liberal arts</hi> (while opifex is a master in the artes sordidae; cf. ars, I. B. 1.), <hi rend="ital">an artist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artificer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi artifices corporis simulacra ignotis nota faciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reponendarum (tegularum) nemo artifex (i. e. architectus) inire rationem potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in armamentario multis talium operum (sc. tormentorum) artificibus de industriā inclusis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aiunt in Graecis artificibus eos auloedos esse, qui citharoedi fieri non potuerint, sic, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 13, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:169 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 169 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifices scaenici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Quinct. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex lignorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a carpenter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">artifex lignarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:44:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 44, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifices lapidum,</quote> <trans><tr>masons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Reg. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex aerarius,</quote> <trans><tr>a worker in bronze</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 14</bibl></cit> (often thus used in Vulg. for opifex).—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi artifices ex Graeciā venerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 22</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 2</bibl>; 41, 20; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 36, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:40:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 40, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:19:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 19, 24</bibl> et saep.—So of <hi rend="ital">a charioteer</hi>, as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">texni/ths</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne hoc gloriae artificis daretur (auriga standing just before),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 186</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 3</bibl>. —Of <hi rend="ital">an orator</hi> or <hi rend="ital">writer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci dicendi artifices et doctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum contra talem artificem (sc. Hortensium oratorem) dicturus essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Quinct. 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">politus scriptor atque artifex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:172" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 51, 172</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n3812.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a master in any thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in doing any thing</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">artifices ad corrumpendum judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex callidus comparandarum voluptatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cotta in ambitione artifex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 12:47" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 12, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serendae in alios invidiae artifex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:86 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 86 al.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n3812.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A maker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contriver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si pulcher est hic mundus, si probus ejus artifex, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tim. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (civitatis) artifex et conditor (est) Deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex omnium natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si indocta consuetudo tam est artifex suavitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Or. 48:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Or. 48, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificem (sc. malorum) mediis immittam Terea flammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 615</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadit ad artificem dirae Polymestora caedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:551" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris infandi artifex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 975" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 975</bibl></cit>.—Ironic.: <cit><quote lang="la">O artificem probum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—Also for <hi rend="ital">a sly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning contriver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inventor of a thing</hi> (cf. ars, II. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">et mihi jam multi crudele canebant Artificis scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 407</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n3812.4" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n3812.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilled in a thing; skilful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingenious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dexterous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bomilcar et per homines talis negotii artifices itinera explorat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles decollandi artifex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex faber de silvā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam artifices saltationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl></cit>.—Also of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">artifices Natura manus admovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tellus artifices ne terat Osca manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:2:62" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex, ut ita dicam, stilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:25:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 25, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mobilitas ignea artifex ad formanda corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir tam artificis ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:55 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 16, 21, § 55 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter, negatas artifex sequi voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:prol. 11" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> prol. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3812.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilfully prepared</hi> or <hi rend="ital">made</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artistic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artificial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingenious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor artifices vivida signa boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:29:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 29, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantae tamque artifices argutiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 4, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex dimicatio,</quote> <bibl
