asarotum: <entryFree id="n3857" type="greek" key="a^sa^ro_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsărōtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)sa/rwton</foreign>, <sense id="n3857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a floor laid in mosaic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:36" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 36</bibl>; cf.: asarotos oecos (= <foreign lang="greek">a)sa/rwtos oi)=kos</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 60, § 184</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, asaroticus lapillus,</quote> <trans><tr>a little mosaic stone</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
asarum: <entryFree id="n3858" type="greek" key="a^sa^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsărum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/sar\on</foreign>, <sense id="n3858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hazelwort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild - spikenard</hi>: Asarum Europaeum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 13, 27, § 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asbestinum: <entryFree id="n3859" type="greek" key="asbesti^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asbestĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. linum), = <foreign lang="greek">a)sbe/stinon</foreign>, <sense id="n3859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of incombustible cloth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 4, § 19</bibl> sqq. (written by Jan as Greek). <cb n="ASCE" /></sense></entryFree>
asbestos: <entryFree id="n3860" type="greek" key="asbesto^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asbestŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. lapis), = <foreign lang="greek">a)/sbestos</foreign> (incombustible), <sense id="n3860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stone of an iron-gray color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">found in Arcadia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">differing from the common asbestos</hi>, perh. amiantus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asbolus: <entryFree id="n3861" type="main" key="Asbo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Asbŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)sbo/lh</foreign>, soot</etym>, <sense id="n3861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a black</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaggy dog of Actœon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 218</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ascalabotes: <entryFree id="n3862" type="main" key="asca^la^bo_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascălăbōtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)skalabw/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n3862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of lizard</hi>, in pure Lat., stellio: Lacerta gecko, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 28, § 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ascalaphus: <entryFree id="n3863" type="main" key="Asca^la^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ascălăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aska/lafos</foreign>, <sense id="n3863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Acheron and Orphne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who made known to Pluto that Proserpine had eaten seven kernels of a pomegranate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of which he was changed by her into an illboding owl</hi> (bubo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:539 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 539 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 462</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ascalia: <entryFree id="n3864" type="greek" key="asca^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascălĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)skali/a</foreign>, <sense id="n3864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the edible part of the artichoke</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 57, § 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ascalo: <entryFree id="n3865" type="main" key="Asca^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ascălo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aska/lwn</foreign>, <sense id="n3865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an important trading town in the southern part of Palestine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Gaza and Azotus upon the sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ascalon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 13, 14, § 68</bibl>; cf. Mann. Palaest. 202.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ascălōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Ascalon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caepa,</quote> <trans><tr>a shallot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:57" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:1" default="NO">12, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 32, § 101</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
ascalpo: <entryFree id="n3866" type="hapax" key="ascalpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-scalpo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n3866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to scratch at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to scratch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 176</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ascania: <entryFree id="n3867" type="main" key="Asca^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ascănĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)askani/a</foreign>, <sense id="n3867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a region in Phrygia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 40, § 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ascanius: <entryFree id="n3868" type="main" key="Asca^ni^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ascănĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aska/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n3868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Ascanian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <trans><tr>in Bithynia</tr>, <tr>near Nicœa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 43, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <trans><tr>in Troas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae,</quote> <trans><tr>in the Ægean Sea</tr>, <tr>over against Troas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 31, 38, § 138</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3869" type="main" key="Asca^ni^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ascănĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aska/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n3869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Æneas and Creüsa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Lavinium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and founder of Alba Longa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 271</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; cf. Wagner ad Verg. A. l. c., and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Exc. ad Aen. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exc. ad Aen. 2</bibl>, n. XVII. p. 438.</sense></entryFree>
ascaules: <entryFree id="n3870" type="greek" key="ascaules"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascaules</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)skau/lhs</foreign>, <sense id="n3870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bagpiper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 3, 8</bibl> (called in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 54</bibl> by the pure Lat. word, utricularius).</sense></entryFree>
ascendens: <entryFree id="n3871" type="main" key="ascendens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascendens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. ascendo <sense id="n3871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ascendibilis: <entryFree id="n3872" type="main" key="ascendi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascendĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ascendo</etym>, <sense id="n3872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be ascended</hi> or <hi rend="ital">climbed</hi>: semita, Pomp. ap. Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:841" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 841</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ascendo: <entryFree id="n3873" type="main" key="ascendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-scendo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, Jan; <orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">as-</orth>, Müller; <orth extent="full" lang="la">as-</orth>, other editors), <itype>scendi, scensum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>scando</etym>, <sense id="n3873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ascend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mount up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">climb;</hi> and in eccl. Lat. simply <hi rend="ital">to go up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spring up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow up</hi> (syn.: scando, conscendo, orior, surgo, prodeo). </sense><sense id="n3873.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (opp. descendo; and diff. from escendo, which designates a climbing, mounting upon some high object, and involves the idea of exertion; cf. Oud. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 61</bibl>; Ochsn. Ecl. pp. 287 and 288; Doed. Syn. IV. pp. 60 and 61; it often interchanges with escendere in MSS.; cf. e. g. Halm ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 8, 6</bibl>, and v. examples below; class.; in Cic. and in Vulg. very freq.), constr. most freq. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, but also with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> with super, supra, contra, adversus, with <case>acc.</case>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (in Cic. in the lit. signif., except once with the <case>acc.</case>, always with <hi rend="ital">in with acc.;</hi> but in the trop. signif. in all constrr.). </sense><sense id="n3873.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in with acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in navem ascendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 54</bibl> Fleck.: <cit><quote lang="la">ascendere in naviculam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in triremem ascendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 3</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 4, 5</bibl>, and Them. 8, 6 Halm now reads <hi rend="ital">escendere</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">in arborem ascendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in Amanum (urbem) ascenderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascende in oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jos. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex peregrinum vetat in murum ascendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 23, 88</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl> (B. and K., <hi rend="ital">escendere</hi>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:28:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 28, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 35, 97</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascensus in caelum): inque plagas caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavete, ne ascendatis in montem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 19, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">24, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tribunal ascendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 14, 34</bibl></cit> (B. and K., <hi rend="ital">escendere</hi>); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 28</bibl> Drak. (Weissenb., <hi rend="ital">escendere</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">in contionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit> (B. and K., <hi rend="ital">escendit</hi>); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 50</bibl> (Weissenb., <hi rend="ital">escendere</hi>, in both these pass.): <cit><quote lang="la">in Capitolium ascendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin vestram ascendisset in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 192</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3873.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad.</hi> ad Gitanas Epiri oppidum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad laevam paulatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3873.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> or <hi rend="ital">loc. adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem ascendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 22, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 4, 1</bibl>; ib. Luc. <pb n="171" /> <cb n="ASCE" /> 8, 37: <cit><quote lang="la">ascendit classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montīs cum ascendimus altos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:82" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 82</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:103:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 103, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">summum jugum montis ascendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastigia montis anheli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altitudinem montium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:37:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 37, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1301</bibl></cit> (Lachm., <hi rend="ital">escendere</hi>); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 12, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversam ripam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 28, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 27</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 507</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 61</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:75:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 75, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascendit Capitolium ad lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus adscensurus, Olympum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum iter ascendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:10:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc solita est ascendere filia Nisi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 394</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo simul ascendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:220" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 220</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mons erat ascendendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus gradus ascendatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus adscenduntur nonagenis gradibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 88</bibl></cit> (Jan, <hi rend="ital">descenduntur</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">ascenso simul curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: ne ascensis tanti sit gloria Bactris, Prop 4, 3, 63.—</sense><sense id="n3873.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, of persons ex locis superioribus desuper suos ascendentes protegebant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā fefellerat ascendens hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ascendit ergo Abram de Aegypto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">19, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ascende huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 12</bibl>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">fons ascendebat de terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut ascendit mare fluctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Ezech. 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ascendit aurora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:32:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gen. 32, 26</bibl></cit>' ascendit ignis de petrā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jud. 6, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascendet fumus ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 34, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidit ascendentem favillam de terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:19:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gen. 19, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascendet sicut virgultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 53, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">germen eorum, ut pulvis, ascendet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 5, 24</bibl></cit>.—Also, after the Greek, <hi rend="ital">to go aboard ship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go out to sea</hi> (eccl. Lat.): ascendentes navigavimus, <foreign lang="greek">e)piba/ntes</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 21, 2</bibl>: Et ascenderunt, <foreign lang="greek">a)nh/xqhsan</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 8, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3873.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3873.7" n="A" level="2"> Constr in like manner, </sense><sense id="n3873.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in with acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in summum locum civitatis ascendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter quem (ornatum) ascendit in tantum honorem eloquentia,</quote> <trans><tr>has grown into such reputation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira ascendit in Israel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:77:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 77, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid cogitationes ascendunt in corda vestra?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:24:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 24, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 7, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3873.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic a principiis ascendit motus et exit paulatim nostros ad sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut a minoribus ad majora ascendimus aut a majoribus ad minora delabimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius ad magnitudinem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:61:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 61, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:241" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hunc gradum amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3873.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">super with acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira Dei ascendit super eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:77:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 77, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascendent sermones super cor tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Ezech. 38, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3873.11" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex honoribus continuis familiae unum gradum dignitatis ascendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altiorem gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 18, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum, quem tenebat, ascenderat gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altissimum (gradum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascendere thalamum, i. e. matrimonium contrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:45" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 45</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summam amplitudinem pervenisset, ascendens gradibus magistratuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:281" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 81, 281</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:58:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 58, 3</bibl>: altius ascendere, Brut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradatim ascendit vox,</quote> <trans><tr>rises</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad nos contemptus Samnitium pervenit, supra non ascendit, i. e. alios non tetigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec ascenderit furor Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:36:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 36, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascendet indignatio mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:38:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Ezech. 38, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3873.12" n="B" level="2"> Esp., super, supra aliquem or aliquid ascendere, <hi rend="ital">to rise above any person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand higher</hi> (twice in Tacitus): <cit><quote lang="la">(liberti) super ingenuos et super nobiles ascendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi supra tribunatus et praeturas et consulatus ascendere videor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ascen-dens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> * </sense><sense id="n3873.13" n="A" level="2"> Machina, <hi rend="ital">a machine for ascending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a scaling-ladder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3873.14" n="B" level="2"> In the jurists, ascendentes are <hi rend="ital">the kindred in an ascending line</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancestors</hi> (<hi rend="ital">parents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grandparents</hi>, etc.; opp. descendentes, <hi rend="ital">descendants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">children</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grandchildren</hi>, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:68" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ascensibilis: <entryFree id="n3874" type="hapax" key="ascensi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascensĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ascendo</etym>, <sense id="n3874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be ascended</hi> or <hi rend="ital">climbed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ascensio: <entryFree id="n3875" type="main" key="ascensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascensĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ascending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascent</hi> (more rare than ascensus). </sense><sense id="n3875.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hirundininum nidum ascensionem ut faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graduum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1, p. 208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 1, p. 208</bibl></cit> Rode: <cit><quote lang="la">via ascensionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:26:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 26, 16</bibl></cit>: dies ascensionis <cb n="ASCI" /> suae de terrā Aegypti, ib. Osee, 2, 15.— </sense><sense id="n3875.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: quorum (oratorum) quae fuerit ascensio et quam in omnibus rebus difficilis optimi perfectio, etc., <hi rend="ital">a rising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soaring</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:36:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 36, 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascensiones in corde suo disposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:83:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 83, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3875.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">means of ascent</hi>: aedificat in caelo ascensionem, Vulg Amos, 9, 6.</sense></entryFree>
ascensor: <entryFree id="n3876" type="main" key="ascensor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascensor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that ascends</hi> (eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n3876.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">montis Dominici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Rufin. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:33:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 33, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3876.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">one that mounts</hi> a horse, chariot, etc., <hi rend="ital">a rider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charioteer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cadat ascensor ejus (equi) retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:49:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 49, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascensor equi, ib. Amos, 2, 15: equum et ascensorem dejecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Exod. 15, 1</bibl></cit>; ib Job, 39, 18.—So <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascensores (sc. equorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:18:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 18, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">asini ascensor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 21, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">cameli, ib. ib.' collidam in te currum et ascensorem ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jer. 21, 51</bibl></cit>. subvertam quadrigam et ascensorem ejus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,045:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Agg. 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ascensus: <entryFree id="n3877" type="main" key="ascensus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascensus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of ascendo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3878" type="main" key="ascensus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascensus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ascendo</etym>, <sense id="n3878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ascending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3878.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">primos prohibere ascensu coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines audaces ab ejus templi aditu atque ascensu repulisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod hosti aditum ascensum ve difficilem praeberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 36</bibl></cit> summi fastigia tecti Ascensu supero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 303</bibl> ascensus muri, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl> Esdr. 12, 36. ascensus altaris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:50:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Eccli. 50, 12</bibl>. adscensus siderum, <hi rend="ital">a rising of the stars to our hemisphere</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 15, § 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascensus aurorae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Esdr. 4, 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,041:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jon. 4, 7</bibl>.—Also in <hi rend="ital">plur</hi>: hostes partim scalis ascensus tentant, Liv 36, 24.—</sense><sense id="n3878.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ollisque ad honoris amplioris gradum is primus ascensus esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">olla propter quae datur homini ascensus in caelum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3878.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. for concr., cf.. aditus, accessus, etc.), <hi rend="ital">a place by which one ascends</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an approach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inambulans atque ascensu ingrediens arduo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 1, 61, 261</bibl></cit> difficilis atque arduus, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr 2, 4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">riget arduus alto Tmolus in ascensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae aedes tribunal habent et ascensum,</quote> <trans><tr>a flight of stairs</tr>, <tr>ascent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7, p. 93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 7, p. 93</bibl></cit> Rode; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:6, p. 111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, p. 111</bibl> Rode.—In <hi rend="ital">plur</hi> ut obtinerent ascensus montium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Reg. 14, 4</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>. in virtute multi ascensus <hi rend="ital">many degrees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 25</bibl> Wund.</sense></entryFree>
asceteria: <entryFree id="n3879" type="greek" key="asce_te_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascētērĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)skhth/ria</foreign>, <sense id="n3879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place of abode for ascetics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hermitage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ascetriae: <entryFree id="n3880" type="greek" key="asce_tri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascētrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)skh/triai</foreign>, <sense id="n3880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">women that have taken vows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">female ascetics</hi>, Novell. Constit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:123" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ascia: <entryFree id="n3881" type="main" key="asci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindred with <foreign lang="greek">a)ci/nh</foreign>, an axe</etym>, <sense id="n3881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an axe for hewing wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a carpenter's axe</hi> (syn.: securis, bipennis, ferrum). </sense><sense id="n3881.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: rogum asciā ne polito, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. Cic Leg 2, 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 198</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tilia ascias retundit, id 16, 40, 76, § 207: in securi et asciā aliquid deicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:73:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 73, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum de saltu praecidit opus manūs artificis in asciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jer. 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—Prov.. asciam sibi in crus impingere or illidere, <hi rend="ital">to cut one's own legs</hi>, Petr 74, 16; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 139, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3881.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3881.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mattock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hoel</hi> asciae in aversā parte referentes rastros, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43, 3</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3881.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mason's trowel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 14</bibl>; upon monuments such a trowel is found pictured, and in the inscription the expression SVB ASCIA or AD ASCIAM DEDICATVM, i. e. consecrated while yet under the trowel (prob this was done in order to protect the empty sepulchre from injury), Inscr Orell. 249, 4464; 4465; 4466; <cit><quote lang="la">4467: PATER ET MATER FILIO DVLCISSIMO AD ASCIAM DEDICATVM POSVERVNT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4468</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
asciburgium: <entryFree id="n3882" type="main" key="Asci^burgi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ascĭburgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n3882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town in</hi> Gallia Belgica, <hi rend="ital">on the Rhine</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Asburg</hi> (but acc. to Mann Gall. 250, now <hi rend="ital">Essenberg;</hi> opp. Duisburg), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> G 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ascio: <entryFree id="n3883" type="hapax" key="asci^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ascia, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n3883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to work</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prepare with a trowel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3884" type="main" key="asci^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-scĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adsc-</orth>, Rib., Halm), īvi (never ii), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, like adopto, arrogo, etc., transf. from the sphere of civil law to common life, <sense id="n3884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to receive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admit</hi> (like scio in this signif., very rare, perh. only in Verg. and Tac.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ascisco): si socios sum adscire paratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, <cb n="ASCI" /> 472: <cit><quote lang="la">adsciri per adoptionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi Tiberium adscivit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsciri in societatem Germanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsciri inter comites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites adscire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ascisco: <entryFree id="n3885" type="main" key="ascisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-scisco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adsc-</orth>, Lachm., Baiter, Dietsch, Weissenb., K. and H., Halm in Tac.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">asc-</orth>, Merk., Kayser, Rib., Halm in Nep.), īvi (in ante-class. and class. Lat. never ii), <itype>ītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n3885.0" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">receive</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">with knowledge</hi> (and approbation), <hi rend="ital">to approve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive as true</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jussisset populus Romanus aliquid, si id ascivissent socii populi ac Latini, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (leges) Latini voluerunt, asciverunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 20</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">21: quibus (scitis) adscitis susceptisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu vero ista ne adsciveris neve fueris commenticiis rebus assensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 40, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne labar ad opinionem, et aliquid adsciscam et comprobem incognitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 45, 138</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3885.1" n="B" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to receive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">admit one in some capacity</hi> (<hi rend="ital">as citizen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son</hi>, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">dominos acrīs adsciscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:63" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perficiam ut hunc A. Licinium non modo non segregandum, cum sit civis, a numero civium, verum etiam, si non esset, putetis asciscendum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">[aliā (civitate) ascitā],</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 3, 1</bibl></cit> Halm: <cit><quote lang="la">Numam Pompilium ... regem alienigenam sibi ipse populus adscivit eumque ad regnandum Romam Curibus adscivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem patronum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socios sibi ad id bellum Osismios, etc., adsciscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 9, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">socius adscitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ducem, Auct. B. Alex. 59, 2: qui non asciverit ultro Dardanium Aenean generumque acceperit urbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 471</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gener inde provecto annis adscitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascivit te filium non vitricus, sed princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:7:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni centurionesque adsciscebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem successorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.—In the histt. also with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> (in civitatem, societatem, senatum, nomen, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">adsciti simul in civitatem et patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul in civitatem Romanam et in familias patriciorum adscitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in numerum patriciorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter patricios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chauci in commilitium adsciti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in penates suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in bona et nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3885.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">receive</hi> a person <hi rend="ital">to</hi> one's self; of things, <hi rend="ital">to appropriate to one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adopt</hi> (diff. from adjungere and assumere, by the accessory idea of exertion and mediation, or of personal reflection; cf. Herz. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 24, 3</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n3885.3" n="1" level="3"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo oppressus aere alieno fuit, quem non ad hoc incredibile sceleris foedus asciverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsulibus omnium civitatium ascitis, receptis latronibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:30" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā tempestate plurimos cujusque generis homines adscivisse dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veientes re secundā elati voluntarios undique ad spem praedae adsciverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 31, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in conscientiam facinoris pauci adsciti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: asciscere for asciscere se or ascisci, <hi rend="ital">to join</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unite one's self to one</hi> (cf.. Accingunt omnes operi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 235</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ascivere tuo comites sub numine divae centum omnes nemorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3885.4" n="2" level="3"> Of things: Quae neque terra sibi adscivit nec maxumus aether, <hi rend="ital">which neither the earth appropriates to itself nor</hi> etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 473</bibl>: Jovisque numen Mulciberi adscivit manus, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 10, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi oppidum asciscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceres et Libera ... quarum sacra populus Romanus a Graecis ascita et accepta tantā religione tuetur, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 72</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Har Resp. 13, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 625</bibl> Heins., where Merk. reads <hi rend="ital">acciverit</hi> (cf. Web. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:831" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 831</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinos ritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Spem si quam ascitis Aetolum habuistis in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opimum quoddam et tamquam adipatae dictionis genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or 8, 25</bibl></cit>: nova (verba) adsciscere, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ipsa natura adsciscat et reprobet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit> (B. and K., <hi rend="ital">sciscat et probet</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">adsciscere aut probare amicitiam aut justitiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa, quae prima sunt adscita naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit> (cf. Beier ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:13, p. 203" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 3, 13, p. 203</bibl>): hanc consuetudinem<pb n="172" /> <cb n="ASCR" />  lubenter ascivimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:57:209" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 57, 209</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n3885.5" n="3" level="3"> Sibi, like arrogo, <hi rend="ital">to assume</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arrogate something to one's self</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">eos illius expertes esse prudentiae, quam sibi asciscerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae laudem uni sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:36:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 36, 95</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n3885.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decree</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">approve also</hi> or <hi rend="ital">further</hi>, = etiam sciscere: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum (genus sacerdotum) quod interpretetur fatidicorum et vatium ecfata incognita, quae eorum senatus populusque adsciverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8</bibl></cit>, ubi v. Moser.— <orth extent="full" lang="la">ascītus</orth>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (opp. nativus, innatus, insitus), <hi rend="ital">derived</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assumed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo nativum quemdam leporem esse, non ascitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 4, 1</bibl></cit> Halm: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:23" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">genitos esse vos mihi, non ascitos milites credite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:3:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec petit ascitas dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:172" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 172</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ascites: <entryFree id="n3886" type="main" key="asci_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ski/ths</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">u(/drwy</foreign>), <sense id="n3886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of dropsy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 3, 12</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 21</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
ascitus: <entryFree id="n3887" type="main" key="asci_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adsc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of ascisco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3888" type="hapax" key="asci_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adsc-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ascisco</etym>, <sense id="n3888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an acceptance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reception</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuitatem doloris alii censent primum ascitum et primum declinatum dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:7:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 7, 18</bibl></cit>, where Madvig reads <hi rend="ital">ascitam;</hi> so B. and K.</sense></entryFree>
ascius: <entryFree id="n3889" type="greek" key="asci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/skios</foreign> (without shadow): <sense id="n3889.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <trans><tr>countries under the equator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 73, 75, § 185</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
asclepiades: <entryFree id="n3890" type="main" key="Ascle_pi^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Asclēpĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)asklhpia/dhs</foreign>. <sense id="n3890.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A distinguished physician of Prusa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Bithynia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friend of Crassus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:14:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 14, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 37, 37, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:15" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 3, 8, § 15</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3890.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A blind philosopher of Eretria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 113</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3890.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inventor of the metre named after him</hi> metrum Asclepiadeum (e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maecenas atavis edite regibus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 508</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
asclepiadeus: <entryFree id="n3891" type="main" key="Ascle_pi^a^de_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Asclēpĭădēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Asclepiades, III.</entryFree>
asclepias: <entryFree id="n3892" type="greek" key="ascle_pi^a^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asclēpĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)sklhpia/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the common swallowwort</hi>: Asclepias vincetoxicum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 5, 18, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asclepiodotus: <entryFree id="n3893" type="main" key="Ascle_pi^o^do^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Asclēpĭŏdŏtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a biographer of Diocletian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asclepion: <entryFree id="n3894" type="greek" key="ascle_pi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asclēpĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n3894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicinal herb named from Æsculapius</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">*)asklhpio/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 11, § 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ascletario: <entryFree id="n3895" type="main" key="Ascle_ta_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Asclētārĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mathematician in the time of Domitian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asclum: <entryFree id="n3896" type="main" key="Asclum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Asclum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. Asculum.</entryFree>
asconius: <entryFree id="n3897" type="main" key="Asco_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ascōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: Q. Asconius Pedianus, <sense id="n3897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a learned grammarian of Padua</hi> (c. A. D. 3-88), <hi rend="ital">who devoted his studies especially to Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sallust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Vergil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and whose valuable commentary upon five orations of Cicero is still extant;</hi> cf. Bähr, <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. § 260; Weich. <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> Lat. p. 274; Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 290.</sense></entryFree>
ascopera: <entryFree id="n3898" type="greek" key="asco^pe_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascŏpēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)skoph/ra</foreign>, <sense id="n3898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leathern bag</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sack</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 45</bibl>: Imposuit abrae suae ascoperam vini, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 10, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ascra: <entryFree id="n3899" type="main" key="Ascra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ascra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/askra</foreign>. <sense id="n3899.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A village in Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Mount Helicon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Hesiod</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:14:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 14, 31</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3899.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">As-craeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)askrai=os</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n3899.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Ascrœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hesiod</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 34, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex, the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 70</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ascraeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Hesiod</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3899.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Hesiod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rural</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:436" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 436</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <trans><tr>which Hesiod pastured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:14" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3899.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of Helicon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Heliconian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:10:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 10, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ascribo: <entryFree id="n3900" type="main" key="ascri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-scrībo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, <itype>Baiter, Halm</itype>, Weissenb., K. and H.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">as-</orth>, Kayser), <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n3900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to annex by writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to add to a writing</hi> (syn.: annumero, addo, insero, attribuo, tribuo). </sense><sense id="n3900.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n3900.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> or with <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">in with acc.</hi> or <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n3900.3" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum illud perscribunt, quod tum prohibiti sunt, sed etiam causam ascribunt cur etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud minime auguris, quod adscripsit, ob eam causam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:16:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 16, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3900.4" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Terentia salutem tibi plurimam adscribit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coheredem sibi libertum ejus adscriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3900.5" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">in with acc.</hi> or <case>abl.</case>: hoc tibi respondeo: ascripsisse eundem Sullam in eandem legem: si quid, etc.: nam nisi esset, hoc in <cb n="ASCR" /> omnibus legibus non ascriberetur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:33:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 33, 95</bibl> (B. and K., <hi rend="ital">in eādem lege</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">antiquior dies in tuis adscripta litteris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alterā epistulā diem non adscribis,</quote> <trans><tr>do not add the date</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen suum in albo profitentium citharoedorum jussit adscribi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 51 al.</bibl>—Esp. freq. of superscriptions and inscriptions: <cit><quote lang="la">Recita epistulam. TIMARCHIDES VERRIS ACCENSVS APRONIO. Jam hoc quidem non reprehendo, quod ascribit ACCENSVS,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non credo ascripturum esse magno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novo si marmori adscripserunt Praxitelem suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5, prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, prol. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulo publice exstructo adscripserant, pro libertate eos occubuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut qui statuarum titulis pronepotem se Q. Catuli Capitolini semper adscripserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3900.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3900.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To impute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attribute to</hi> one the cause of something: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc incommodum Scipioni ascribendum videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panaces diis inventoribus adscriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 11, § 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 81</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and (per hypallagen, cf. Rudd. II. p. 393): cur autem ascribimus illum his lacrimis (instead of illi has lacrimas),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 419</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Idyll. 6, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomini meo adscribatur victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 12, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3900.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To place to one's credit</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">designate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appoint</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eidem (servo) adscripsisse legatum,</quote> <trans><tr>bequeathed to him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam lues, olim cum adscriptus venerit poenae dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3900.9" n="3" level="3"> Adscribere sibi aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to apply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refer something to one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui facere quae non possunt, verbis elevant, Adscribere hoc debebunt exemplum sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3900.10" n="II. A." level="1"> Esp., t. t., <hi rend="ital">to enroll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter in a list</hi> (<hi rend="ital">as citizen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soldier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colonist</hi>, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">ascribi se in eam civitatem voluit,</quote> <trans><tr>to be entered</tr>, <tr>received as a citizen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui foederatis civitatibus ascripti fuissent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanae militiae adscribebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adscribantur ex Judaeis in exercitu regis ad triginta milia virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 10, 36</bibl></cit>: adscripti dicebantur qui in colonias nomina dedissent, ut essent coloni, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 13</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">colonos Venusiam adscripserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 49</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:24" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:42" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 42</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">35, 9 al.: coloniam deduxit adscriptis veteranis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so also of ambassadors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 17, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n3900.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3900.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To reckon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">number in a class</hi>, <hi rend="ital">include among</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adscripsit Liber Satyris poëtas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 4</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribe tui gregis hunc): aliquem ordinibus deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationes Germanis an Sarmatis adscribam, dubito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem antiquis temporibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3900.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To add</hi> or <hi rend="ital">join to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hoc genus ascribamus etiam narrationes apologorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admiratus eorum fidem tyrannus petivit, ut se ad amicitiam tertium adscriberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 45</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:22:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 22, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu vero ascribe me in talem numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae alicujus sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus A. Gabinius belli maritimi Cn. Pompeio socius ascribitur, i. e. additur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Hence also of attributes of a deity: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovi aquila adscribitur,</quote> <trans><tr>is ascribed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 5, 6, § 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ascripticius: <entryFree id="n3901" type="main" key="ascripti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascriptīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adscr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ascribo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n3901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">enrolled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">received in any community</hi> (<hi rend="ital">as citizen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soldier</hi>, etc.): novi et adscripticii cives, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:15:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 15, 39</bibl>: ascripticii veluti quidam scripti dicebantur, qui supplendis legionibus ascribebantur. Hos et accensos dicebant, quod ad legionum censum essent adscripti, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 14</bibl> Müll.; cf. ascriptivus: servi, <hi rend="ital">slaves bound to the soil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and transferred with it from one possessor to another</hi>, Cod. 11, 47, 6.</sense></entryFree>
ascriptio: <entryFree id="n3902" type="hapax" key="ascripti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascriptĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adscr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ascribo, I.</etym>, <sense id="n3902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an addition in writing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">declarat ipsa asc/riptio esse aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:33:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 33, 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ascriptivus: <entryFree id="n3903" type="main" key="ascripti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascriptīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adscr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ascribo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n3903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">enrolled as a</hi> (<hi rend="ital">supernumerary</hi>) <hi rend="ital">soldier</hi> (cf. ascripticius and accensus): <cit><quote lang="la">Idem istuc aliis adscriptivis ad legionem fieri solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=56" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 56</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ascriptor: <entryFree id="n3904" type="main" key="ascriptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascriptor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adscr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ascribo, I.</etym>, <sense id="n3904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who willingly subscribes</hi> (<hi rend="ital">his name</hi>); hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">he who subscribes to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agrees to</hi>, <cb n="ASIA" /> <hi rend="ital">approves any thing</hi> (perh. only in the foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">ascriptores legis agrariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venalis ascriptor et subscriptor tuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ascriptus: <entryFree id="n3905" type="main" key="ascriptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascriptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adscr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of ascribo.</entryFree>
asculum: <entryFree id="n3906" type="main" key="Ascu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ascŭlum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Asclum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:440" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 440</bibl>, and Itin. Anton.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/askoulon</foreign>, more freq. <foreign lang="greek">*)/asklon</foreign>. <sense id="n3906.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The capital of Picenum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ascoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18:14" default="NO">1, 18, 14</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital.
