I. p. 492.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ascŭlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Asculum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Asculanian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 44, § 135</bibl></cit>. —<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ascŭlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Asculum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3906.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Apulia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18, 9</bibl> Duker; hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">As-cŭlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Asculinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 110" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ascyroides: <entryFree id="n3907" type="greek" key="ascy^ro^i_de^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascyrŏīdĕs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)skuroeide/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant similar to the</hi> ascyron, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 5, 20, § 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ascyron: <entryFree id="n3908" type="greek" key="ascy^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ascyron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/skuron</foreign>, <sense id="n3908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> androsaemon, <hi rend="ital">St. John's-wort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 4, 10, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asdrubal: <entryFree id="n3909" type="main" key="Asdru^bal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Asdrŭbal</orth>, v. Hasdrubal.</entryFree>
asella: <entryFree id="n3910" type="main" key="a^sella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>asina</etym>, <sense id="n3910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small sheass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 290</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asellio: <entryFree id="n3911" type="main" key="Aselli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Asellĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the early Roman historians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asellulus: <entryFree id="n3912" type="hapax" key="a^sellu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsellŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n3912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doub. dim.</hi> [asellus], <hi rend="ital">a small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young ass</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asellus: <entryFree id="n3913" type="main" key="a^sellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>asinus</etym>, <sense id="n3913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little ass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ass's colt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3913.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dossuarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: asellus onustus auro, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lente gradiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 179</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 16, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:12:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 12, 14 al.</bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">narrare fabellam surdo asello,</quote> <trans><tr>to preach to deaf ears</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 199</bibl></cit> (an imitation of a Greek proverb, <foreign lang="greek">*)/onw| tis e)/lege mu=qon : o( de\ ta\ w)=ta e)ki/nei</foreign>; cf. Schmid ad Hor. l. c.).—</sense><sense id="n3913.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3913.3" n="A" level="2"> Of a man addicted to sensuality, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Hier. Vit. S. Hilar.—</sense><sense id="n3913.4" n="B" level="2"> Aselli, <hi rend="ital">two stars in Cancer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sunt in signo Cancri duae stellae parvae, Aselli appellati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 80, § 353</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr 2:23" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr 2, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3913.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sea-fish much prized by the Romans</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">cod</hi> or <hi rend="ital">haddock</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=77, p. 31" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 77, p. 31</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 28, § 61</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">post asellum diaria non sumo,</quote> <trans><tr>after delicious fare I take no common food</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3913.6" n="D" level="2"> Asellus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 258</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:41 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 41 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
asemus: <entryFree id="n3914" type="greek" key="a^se_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsēmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/shmos</foreign> (without sign): <sense id="n3914.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <trans><tr>that has not the purple stripe</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
asia:
<entryFree id="n3915" type="main" key="A_^si^a" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^sĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (in regard to the quantity of the A, cf. Jahn ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 648</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*)asi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n3915.0" n="I. A." level="1"> Orig., <hi rend="ital">a town in Lydia;</hi> afterwards <hi rend="ital">the region around it;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n3915.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^sĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Asia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <trans><tr>the marshy region on the river Cayster</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 701</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 383</bibl>, and Hom. Il. 2, 461; <cit><quote lang="la">Asia,</quote> <trans><tr>a nymph</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 343</bibl></cit>; cf. Hyg. Fab. prooem.— </sense><sense id="n3915.2" n="II. A." level="1"> In an extended signif., <hi rend="ital">Asia Minor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 557</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:19:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 19, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21, 27 al.</bibl>—Hence also for Pergamos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 4</bibl>; and, as a Roman province, or Proconsular Asia, <foreign lang="greek">kat' e)coxh/n</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">h( i)di/ws kaloume/nh *)adi/a</foreign>, Strabo, 17, p. 118), Asia comprehended Mysia, Lydia, Caria, and Phrygia; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Namque, ut opinor, Asia vestra constat ex Phrygiā, Cariā, Mysiā, Lydiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Cor. 16, 19</bibl> et saep.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n3915.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^sĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Asiatic</hi> (cf. Asiaticus): villa, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 466, 3</bibl>.— For <hi rend="ital">Troas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 484</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3915.4" n="III" level="1"> In a still wider sense, <hi rend="ital">the whole of the quarter of the globe Asia</hi> (hence the distinction Asia Minor, <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 1, 2</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 47</bibl> sqq.—A <usg type="style">poet.</usg> form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^sis</orth>, <itype>īdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Asia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 648</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 448</bibl>.</sense>
†† <sense id="n3915.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">asĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; among the Taurini, <hi rend="ital">rye</hi>, in pure Lat., secale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 40, § 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asiagenes: <entryFree id="n3916" type="main" key="A_^si^a^ge^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^sĭăgĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)asiagenh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of</hi> Scipio Asiaticus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 7, 80</bibl>; cf. Gron. Obs. 4, 391 (p. 531 Frotsch.).</sense></entryFree>
asiane: <entryFree id="n3917" type="main" key="A_^si^a_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^sĭānē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Asianus.</entryFree>
asianus: <entryFree id="n3918" type="main" key="A_^si^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^sĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)asiano/s</foreign>. <sense id="n3918.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Asiatic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Roman province of</hi> <pb n="173" /> <cb n="ASIN" /> <hi rend="ital">Asia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^sĭāni</orth>,<itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the province of Asia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 26, 98, § 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 20, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3918.1" n="II" level="1"> In rhet.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^sĭāni</orth>, <hi rend="ital">orators who employ a peculiarly bombastic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">redundant style</hi> (cf. Asiaticus, II.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl> prooem. 17; 12, 10, 1; 12, 12, 16.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^sĭānē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the Asiatic style</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
asiarcha: <entryFree id="n3919" type="greek" key="A_^si^archa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^sĭarcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)asia/rxhs</foreign>, <sense id="n3919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a high-priest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and overseer of games and theatrical exhibitions in the Roman province of Asia</hi>, Cod. Th. 15, 9, 2.</sense></entryFree>
asiaticianus: <entryFree id="n3920" type="main" key="A_^si^a_ti^ci^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^sĭātĭcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Asiaticus</etym>, <sense id="n3920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the Asiatic style</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">SCAENICI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2642</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
asiaticus: <entryFree id="n3921" type="main" key="A_^si^a_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^sĭātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)asiatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n3921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Asiatic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3921.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 28, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Persica,</quote> <trans><tr>a fruit from Asia</tr>, <tr>a kind of peach</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 12, 11, § 39</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiatica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:412" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picturae genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 75</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n3921.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. as rhet. t., <hi rend="ital">Asiatic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bombaslic</hi>: genus dicendi, <hi rend="ital">a bombastic style of discourse</hi>, peculiar to Asiatics, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:325" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 95, 325</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 95, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 8, 27</bibl>, and Asianus, II.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^sĭātĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the surname of Cornelius Scipio</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who conquered Antiochus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of</hi> Scipio Africanus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 19</bibl>; cf. Asiagenes.</sense></entryFree>
asilus: <entryFree id="n3922" type="greek" key="a^si_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsīlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gad-fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horse-fly</hi>, usu. tabanus (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 100</bibl>); Gr. <foreign lang="greek">oi)=stros</foreign> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 8, 15</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 147</bibl> (cf. Hom. Od. 22, 300). (Even in Seneca's time the word was antiquated; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 100</bibl>.)</sense></entryFree>
asina: <entryFree id="n3923" type="main" key="a^si^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<case>dat.</case> and <sense id="n3923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> asinabus rest only on the assertion of <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 733</bibl> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">Rhem Pal. 1365 P., and Phoc. p. 1707 P.: asinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 40, 95, § 233</bibl></cit>, acc. to which it should be considered as <hi rend="ital">masc.;</hi> cf. Schne<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Gr. II. p. 26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gr. II. p. 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 39</bibl>, and Rudd. I. p. 50, n. 31) [asinus]. </sense><sense id="n3923.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A she-ass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:8:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 8, 1</bibl> and 6; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 171</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 12, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:22:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Num. 22, 21</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 12, 15</bibl> et persaepe: <cit><quote lang="la">molendaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3923.2" n="II" level="1"> Asina, <hi rend="ital">a Roman</hi> cognomen, e. g. Cn. Scipio Asina, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asinaeus: <entryFree id="n3924" type="main" key="Asi^naeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Asĭnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Asine.</entryFree>
asinalis: <entryFree id="n3925" type="hapax" key="a^si^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>asinus</etym>, <sense id="n3925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">asinine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doltish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slupid</hi> (v. asinus, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">asinali verecundiā ductus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 153, 3</bibl></cit> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
asinarius: <entryFree id="n3926" type="main" key="a^si^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an ass</hi>: mola, <hi rend="ital">a millstone</hi> turned by an ass, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 4</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Marc. 9, 41</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n3926.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n3926.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a keeper of asses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ass-driver</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 1</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3926.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăsĭnārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a comedy of Plautus.</hi>—(That the Via Asinaria (Paul. ex Fest. s. v retricibus, p. 282 Müll.), <hi rend="ital">a side branch of the</hi> Via Latina, and the Porta Asinaria, were named from asinus, since upon this street and through this gate asses brought vegetables, fruit, etc., to Rome, is justly questioned in Platner's Gesch. d. Stadt Rom, p. 663, in opp. to Müll. Roms Camp. I. pp. 3 and 4.)</sense></entryFree>
asine: <entryFree id="n3927" type="main" key="A^si^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăsĭnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)asi/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n3927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Messenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 7, § 15</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăsĭnae-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Asine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 7, § 15</bibl></cit>; cf. Mann. Gr. 546.</sense></entryFree>
asinianus: <entryFree id="n3928" type="main" key="A^si^ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăsĭnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Asinius.</entryFree>
asininus: <entryFree id="n3929" type="main" key="a^si^ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsĭnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>asinus</etym>, <sense id="n3929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">produced by an ass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:38:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus,</quote> <trans><tr>ass's foal</tr>, <tr>a young ass</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 30, § 72</bibl></cit>, where Jan reads <hi rend="ital">asini</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruna asinina cognominata a vilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 13, 12, § 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
asinius: <entryFree id="n3930" type="main" key="A^si^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăsĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n3930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens; <hi rend="ital">the most celebrated was</hi> Asinius Pollio, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Augustus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founder of the first library in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and author of a history</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now lost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the civil war between Cœsar and Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31 sq.</bibl> Manut.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:125" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 125</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 10</bibl>; cf. Bähr, <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. § 192; Weich. Poët. Lat. pp. 155, 293, 327, 395; Teuffel, Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 218.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ăsĭnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining<cb n="ASPA" />  to the</hi> gens Asinia, or <hi rend="ital">to an Asinius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
asinus: <entryFree id="n3931" type="main" key="a^si^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>acc. to Benfey, I. p. 123, and Hehn foll. by Curtius, an oriental word, perh. the Heb. <foreign />, asina; cf. Goth. asilus; Lith. asilas; Erse, assul; Celt. asen or assen; Engl. ass; and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)/nos</foreign>, which latter two forms the Lat. seems to have in combination</etym>, <sense id="n3931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ass.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3931.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:6:1 al" default="NO">2, 6, 1 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:7:1 al" default="NO">6, 7, 1 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 167</bibl> sqq. et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 12, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 13, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 5</bibl> et persaepe.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui asinum non potest, stratum caedit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he</tr>, <tr>that cannot find the offender</tr>, <tr>avenges himself on the unoffending</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tegulis, of an odd appearance,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 45, 63</bibl></cit>: ad lyram, of an awkward man, acc. to Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulturā asini sepelietur, of a contemptible and unworthy man,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:22:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 22, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3931.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an ass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dolt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simpleton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blockhead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego homines magis asinos umquam vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 4</bibl>. —Hence, as a term of insult: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid tu autem huic, asine, auscultas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid nunc te, asine, litteras doceam? Non opus est verbis, sed fustibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
asinusca: <entryFree id="n3932" type="main" key="a^si^nusca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsĭnusca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>asinus</etym>, <sense id="n3932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of grape of little value</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asio: <entryFree id="n3933" type="main" key="a^si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a horned owl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 33, § 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:117" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 6, 38, § 117</bibl> (in both these passages Jan reads <hi rend="ital">axio</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
asis: <entryFree id="n3934" type="main" key="A_^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^sis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. 1. Asia <sense id="n3934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
asius: <entryFree id="n3935" type="main" key="A_^si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ā^sĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Asia, I. B. and II. B.</entryFree>
asmiraea: <entryFree id="n3936" type="main" key="Asmi_raea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Asmīraea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district and city in</hi> Serica, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asmura: <entryFree id="n3937" type="main" key="Asmu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Asmūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n3937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Hyrcania, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6</bibl></sense></entryFree>
asnaus: <entryFree id="n3938" type="main" key="Asnaus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Asnaus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in</hi> Macedonia, Liv 32, 5.<</sense></entryFree>
asoi: <entryFree id="n3939" type="main" key="Aso_i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Asōi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <sense id="n3939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plur m.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> India, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asomatus: <entryFree id="n3940" type="greek" key="a^so_ma^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsōmătus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)sw(matos</foreign>, <sense id="n3940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incorporeal</hi>, profatus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
asopiades: <entryFree id="n3941" type="main" key="A_so_pi^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Āsōpĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n3941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">patr.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aswpia/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">grandson of Asopus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Æacus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 484</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asopis: <entryFree id="n3942" type="main" key="A_so_pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Āsōpis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n3942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Gr. Asopidos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 616</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Gr Asopida, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 113</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*)aswpi/s</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n3942.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Asopus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ægina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mother of Æacus by Jupiter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 113</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 616</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3942.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">His daughter Evadne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3942.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A name of the island Eubœa</hi> (after Eubœa, the third daughter of Asopus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 21, § 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3942.4" n="IV" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> for <hi rend="ital">Bœotian</hi> (v Asopus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:370" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 370</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asopus: <entryFree id="n3943" type="main" key="A_so_pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Āsōpus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<case>nom.</case> Gr. Asopos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:315" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 315</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Gr. Asopon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 33</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*)aswpo/s</foreign>. <sense id="n3943.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Bœotia;</hi> personified, <hi rend="ital">the father of Ægina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Evadne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Eubœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and grandfather of Æacus</hi> (v. Asopis and Asopiades), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3943.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Thessaly</hi>, Liv 36, 22.—</sense><sense id="n3943.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In Phrygia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 105</bibl></sense></entryFree>
asotia: <entryFree id="n3944" type="greek" key="a^so_ti_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsōtīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)swtei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n3944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dissoluteness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sensuality</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:17:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:8" default="NO">19, 9, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asotus: <entryFree id="n3945" type="greek" key="a^so_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăsōtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/swtos</foreign>, <sense id="n3945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dissolute man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a debauchee</hi> (only in Cic.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 23</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aspalathus: <entryFree id="n3946" type="greek" key="aspa^la^thus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspălăthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)spa/laqos</foreign>, <sense id="n3946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thorny shrub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose bark and roots yielded a fragrant oil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which was used in the preparation of spiced wine</hi> (vinum aromatites), <hi rend="ital">rosewood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 24, 52, § 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 7, 7, § 30</bibl></sense></entryFree>
aspalax: <entryFree id="n3947" type="greek" key="aspa^lax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspălax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)spa/lac</foreign>, <sense id="n3947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb now unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 31, § 99</bibl>, where Jan reads <hi rend="ital">spalax.</hi></sense></entryFree>
aspar: <entryFree id="n3948" type="main" key="Aspar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aspar</orth>, <itype>ăris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n3948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Numidian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 108:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 108, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:112:1" default="NO" valid="yes">112, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asparagium: <entryFree id="n3949" type="main" key="Aspa^ra_gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aspărāgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n3949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Illyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the river Genusus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Iskarpar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asparagus: <entryFree id="n3950" type="greek" key="aspa^ra^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspărăgus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">asph-</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 84</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)spa/ragos</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">a)sf-</foreign>). <sense id="n3950.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Asparagus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 61</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:45" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 145</bibl> sqq.; 19, 4, 19, § 54; Juv 11, 69; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87</bibl> (perh. in Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 550, 11</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">asparagos</hi> should be read instead of <hi rend="ital">sparagos</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n3950.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sprout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shoot</hi>, like asparagus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 17, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:91" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 15, 54, § 91</bibl>. <cb n="ASPE" /></sense></entryFree>
aspargo: <entryFree id="n3951" type="main" key="aspargo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspargo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. 1. aspergo.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n3952" type="main" key="aspargo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspargo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, v. 2. aspergo.</entryFree>
aspasia: <entryFree id="n3953" type="main" key="Aspa_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aspāsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aspasi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n3953.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The accomplished friend of Socrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards wife of Pericles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:31:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 31, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3953.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The mistress of the younger Cyrus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 10, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aspectabilis: <entryFree id="n3954" type="main" key="aspecta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspectābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adsp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aspecto</etym> (perh. only in the foll. exs.). <sense id="n3954.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That may be seen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visible</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tim. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3954.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Worthy of being seen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil esse aspectabilius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 282, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aspectamen: <entryFree id="n3955" type="hapax" key="aspecta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspectāmen</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adsp-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sight</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 2, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aspectio: <entryFree id="n3956" type="hapax" key="aspecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspectĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adsp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aspicio</etym>, <sense id="n3956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a view</hi>, Fest. s. v. spectio, p. 333 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
aspecto: <entryFree id="n3957" type="main" key="aspecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspecto</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adsp-</orth>, Ritschl; <orth extent="full" lang="la">asp-</orth>, <itype>Lachmann</itype>, Fleck., Rib., B. and K., Halm), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look at attentively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n3957.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): hicine est Telamon, quem aspectabant, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid me adspectas, stolide?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Estne ita ut tibi dixi? Adspecta et contempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 114</bibl>: Quid me aspectas? Quid taces? Ter Eun. 3, 5, 12: Quid me aspectas? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 42</bibl> Illum aspectari, claro qui incedit honore, <hi rend="ital">is gazed upon</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 76</bibl>: Et stabula aspectans regnis excessit avitis, <hi rend="ital">and looking back upon</hi> (<hi rend="ital">with regret</hi>), etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 186</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 251</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3957.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3957.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay attention to a thing</hi> jussa principis aspectare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3957.4" n="B" level="2"> Of places as objects, <hi rend="ital">to look towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overlook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie towards</hi> (cf. specto) collis, qui adversas aspectat desuper arces, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 420</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare, quod Hiberniam insulam aspectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aspectus: <entryFree id="n3958" type="main" key="aspectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adsp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of aspicio</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3959" type="main" key="aspectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adsp-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n3959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> aspecti, Att. ap <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 485, 21</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 712</bibl> P.; Rudd. I. p. 103, n. 46; <hi rend="ital">dat. sing.</hi> aspectu, like jussu, manu, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 465</bibl>; cf. Schneid Gr II. 332) [aspicio]. </sense><sense id="n3959.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a seeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">looking at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sight.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3959.2" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: intellegens dicendi existimator uno aspectu et praeteriens de oratore saepe judicat, Cic <bibl default="NO"><author>Brut.</author> 54, 200</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e quibus (litteris tuis) primo aspectu voluptatem cepi, quod erant a te ipso scriptae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit> hic primo aspectu inanimum quiddam se putat cernere, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D 2, 35, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs situ est praeclaro ad aspectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr 2, 4, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voci tamen et aspectui pepercit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 61</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n3959.3" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. of obj.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adj. for gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carere aspectu civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum aspectum lucemque vitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 26, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectum civium gravari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se aspectu alicujus subtrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aspectu alicujus auferri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectum alicujus fugere, Sen Hippol. 734: aspectum alicujus rei exuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te aspectus detinet urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aspectu earum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:30:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 30, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violare sacra aspectu virili, i. e. virorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Har Resp. 5, 8</bibl></cit>. in aspectu tuo gaudebit, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 11, 8</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic orsus Apollo Mortales medio aspectus sermone reliquit, i. e. mortalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 657</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n3959.4" n="B" level="2"> Physically, <hi rend="ital">the sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubricos oculos fecit (natura) et mobiles, ut aspectum, quo vellent, facile converterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl></cit>: si contendemus per continuationem, acri aspectu utemur, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 3, 15, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3959.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sense of sight</hi>: Sed mihi ne utiquam cor consentit cum oculorum aspectu, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 52</bibl>' quicquid sub aspectum oculorum cadit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 13, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum ita aptum est. ut sub aspectum et tactum cadat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tim. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectum omnino amittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res caecae et ab aspectūs judicio remotae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 357</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3959.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> (i. e. transferred to the object seen). </sense><sense id="n3959.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The visibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adspectu siderum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 68, 68, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">In sedecim partes caelum in eo adspectu divisere Tusci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 54, 55, § 143</bibl></cit>, where Jan reads <hi rend="ital">spectu.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n3959.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The manner of appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aspect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mien</hi>, <hi rend="ital">countenance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3959.9" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: quadrupes aspectu truci, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div 2, 64, 133</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Horribili super aspectu mortalibus instans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat rotis horribilis aspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: pomorum<pb n="174" /> <cb n="ASPE" />  jucundus aspectus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat aspectus ejus sicut fulgur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus faciei illius immutatus est super Sidrach etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Dan. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit (Iphicrates) et animo magno et corpore imperatoriāque formā, ut ipso aspectu cuivis iniceret admirationem sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphicr. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Canidia et Sagana horrendae aspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes horridae adspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(rex) erat terribilis aspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum (erat) aspectu delectabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gen. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bucephalus adspectu torvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 64, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus cruento aspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:32 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 32 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3959.10" n="2" level="3"> Of shape, <hi rend="ital">the form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba adspectu roris marini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 113, § 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:115" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 39, 56, § 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">super similitudinem throni similitudo quasi aspectus hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: quasi aspectus equorum, ib. Joel, 2, 4.—</sense><sense id="n3959.11" n="3" level="3"> Of color, <hi rend="ital">the color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carbunculi adspectūs nigrioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 2, 20, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cum color albus in cute fuerit et capillorum mutaverit aspectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 13, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Ezech. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aspello: <entryFree id="n3960" type="main" key="aspello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-pello</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype> (abspulsus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Differ. Vocab. p. 473" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Differ. Vocab. p. 473</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ab-pello; cf. ab <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>, <sense id="n3960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi> (only ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">eos, qui advorsum eunt, aspellito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 20</bibl> Bentl., Fleck.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: longe a leto aspellor, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:10:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 10, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aspendios: <entryFree id="n3961" type="greek" key="aspendi^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspendĭos</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)spe/ndios</foreign>, <sense id="n3961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of vine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 18, 22, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aspendos: <entryFree id="n3962" type="main" key="Aspendos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Aspendos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/aspendos</foreign>, <sense id="n3962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town built by the Argives</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Pamphylia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Eurymedon</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Minugat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 20, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 14, 1</bibl>.—Also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aspendum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 26, § 96</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 73</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Aspendĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Aspendos</hi>: <itype>Aspendii, ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Aspendos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 2</bibl>. A harper of Aspendos was distinguished in antiquity for playing with the fingers of the left hand (instead of the plectrum), and on the side of the instrument turned inwards, and accordingly concealed from the view of the spectators. Hence, Aspendius was used proverbially of a man that took more thought for his own than for others' advantage: <cit><quote lang="la">Aspendius citharista, quem omnia intus canere dicebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit> Ascon.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">atque hoc carmen hic tribunus plebis non vobis, sed sibi intus canit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
asper: <entryFree id="n3963" type="main" key="asper1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asper</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (aspra = aspera, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299</bibl>, but Vahl. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 166</bibl> reads <sense id="n3963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spissa</hi> instead of <hi rend="ital">aspra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspris = asperis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 379</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">aspro = aspero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Insit. 67</bibl></cit>) [etym. dub.; Doed. foll. by Hinter connects it with <foreign lang="greek">a)spai/rw</foreign>, to struggle, to resist; Corssen, Ausspr. II. p. 593, regards asper (i. e. ab spe) as the proper opposite of prosper (i. e. pro spe); thus asper originally meant <hi rend="ital">hopeless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desperate;</hi> v. also <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> II. p. 870; cf. the use of res asperae as the opposite of res prosperae]; as affecting the sense of touch, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uneven</hi> (opp. lēvis or lenis; syn.: scaber, acutus, insuavis, acerbus, amarus, mordax, durus). </sense><sense id="n3963.1" n="I. 1." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua aspera tactu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1150</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 508</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 556</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 325</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mixta aspera levibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 471</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locis (spectatur) plani an montuosi, leves an asperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:10:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 10, 36</bibl></cit>: Quid judicant sensus? dulce, amarum; <cit><quote lang="la">lene, asperum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:12:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulus asperi (sc. saxibus) soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 36</bibl></cit>: saxa, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 37</bibl>; Pac. ap. Mar. Vict. p. 2522 P.; Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 10, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 76</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Leucas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 42</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 27, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae asperae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,050:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Bar. 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallis aspera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Deut. 21, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: unda, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">glacies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 490</bibl></cit>; Claud. ap. Prob. Cons. 270: Phasis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">frozen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ice-bound</hi>, Prob. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> I. 375</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of climate: aspera caelo Germania,</quote> <trans><tr>harsh</tr>, <tr>severe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 2</bibl></cit>: arteria. <hi rend="ital">the windpipe</hi> (v. arteria), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.—Of raised work (i. e. bas-relief, etc., as being rough), as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">traxu/s</foreign> (cf. exaspero): <cit><quote lang="la">aspera signis Pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cymbiaque argento perfecta atque aspera signis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signis exstantibus asper Antiquus crater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 235</bibl></cit> <cb n="ASPE" /> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stantem extra pocula caprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:76" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 76</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">Summus inaurato crater erat asper acantho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 701</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 899" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 899</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balteus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:578" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 578</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingula bacis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 89</bibl></cit>; cf. Drak. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:279" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 279</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummus,</quote> <trans><tr>not worn smooth</tr>, <tr>new</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <trans><tr>agitated by a storm</tr>, <tr>rough</tr>, <tr>tempestuous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 16</bibl></cit>.—Of things that have <hi rend="ital">a rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thorny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prickly</hi> exterior: <cit><quote lang="la">barba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:32" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mucro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 139</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 54</bibl>: pugionem vetustate obtusum asperari saxo jussit; v. aspero).—</sense><sense id="n3963.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of food: <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Asper meus victus sanest. <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> Sentisne essitas? <hi rend="ital">He. My fare is very rough. Er. Do you feed on brambles?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 85</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 37</bibl>; also of a cough <hi rend="ital">producing hoarseness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (fauces) aspera vexat Assidue tussis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:86:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 86, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n3963.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">aspĕrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an uneven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latens in asperis radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:67" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter aspera et confragosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aspera et devia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erunt aspera in vias planas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 40, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 3, 5</bibl>.—Also in the <hi rend="ital">sup. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperrimo hiemis Ticinum usque progressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3963.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3963.5" n="1" level="3"> Of taste, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brackish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acrid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pungent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperum, Pater, hoc (vinum) est: aliud lenius, sodes, vide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asper sapor maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 100, 104, § 222</bibl></cit>: allium asperi saporis; <cit><quote lang="la">quo plures nuclei fuere, hoc est asperius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 6, 34, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperrimum piper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 7, 14, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum quam asperrimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 9, 39, § 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3963.6" n="2" level="3"> Of sound, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grating</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">(pronuntiationis genus) lene, asperum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 57, 216</bibl></cit>.—Hence a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of <hi rend="ital">the letter R</hi> (<hi rend="ital">also called </hi>littera canina), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:481" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 481</bibl>.—In rhetoric, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rugged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irregular</hi>: quidam praefractam et asperam compositionem probant; <cit><quote lang="la">virilem putant et fortem, quae aurem inaequalitate percutiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 16, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duram potius atque asperam compositionem malim esse quam effeminatam et enervem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:142" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 142</bibl></cit>. And in gram., spiritus asper, the <hi rend="ital">h</hi> sound, <hi rend="ital">the aspirate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 572</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n3963.7" n="3" level="3"> Of smell, <hi rend="ital">sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pungent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba odoris asperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 41, § 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3963.8" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3963.9" n="A. a." level="1"> Of moral qualities, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unkind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi> (cf.: acerbus, acer, and Wagner ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 14</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">quos naturā putes asperos atque omnibus iniquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 16, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator truculentus, asper, maledicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 34, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera Juno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis monitoribus asper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres vestros, asperrimos illos ad condicionem pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus non asper egenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cladibus asper,</quote> <trans><tr>exasperated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 485</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperaque est illi difficilisque Venus,</quote> <trans><tr>unfriendly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:20" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Galatea) acrior igni, Asperior tribulis, fetā truculentior ursā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:803" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 803</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quam aspera est nimium sapientia indoctis hominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asper contemptor divom Mezentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera Pholoe,</quote> <trans><tr>coy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of a <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">austere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigid</hi> view of life, or manner of living: <cit><quote lang="la">accessit istuc doctrina (sc. Stoicorum) non moderata nec mitis, sed paulo asperior et durior quam aut veritas aut natura patiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Stoici) horridiores evadunt, asperiores, duriores et oratione et verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:28:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 28, 78</bibl></cit> (v. asperitas, II. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">(Cato) asperi animi et linguae acerbae et immodice liberae fuit, sed rigidae innocentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Karthago) studiis asperrima belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 14</bibl></cit>, ubi v. Wagner: <cit><quote lang="la">Camilla aspera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 664</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gens laboribus et bellis asperrima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo aspera,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Diana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 87" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3963.10" n="b" level="4"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(anguis) asper siti atque exterritus aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos aspera cornu, i. e. minax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:6:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (lupus) asper Saevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus dulcedine sanguinis asper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (leo) asper retro redit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 794</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigris aspera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(equus) asper frena pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:387" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 387</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3963.11" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troublesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calamitous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruel</hi>, etc. (most freq. in the poets): <cit><quote lang="la">in periculis et asperis temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 9</bibl></cit>: qui labores, pericula, dubias atque asperas <cb n="ASPE" /> res facile toleraverant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 2</bibl>: mala res, spes multo asperior, (<hi rend="ital">our</hi>) <hi rend="ital">circumstances are bad</hi>, (<hi rend="ital">our</hi>) <hi rend="ital">prospects still worse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 20:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 48, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 635</bibl></cit>;
