<bibl default="NO">12, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 882</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 96</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa aspera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 21 al.</bibl>—Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abusive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperioribus facetiis perstringere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:4:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:6:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:90:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 90, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3963.12" n="a" level="4"> Old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">asperĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">roughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harshly</hi>: cubare, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 513, 21</bibl>; Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n3963.13" n="b" level="4"> Class. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">aspĕrē</orth> (in fig. signif.), <hi rend="ital">roughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harshly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemently</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n3963.14" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabae aspere coëuntes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3963.15" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspere accipere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspere et acerbe accusare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspere agere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspere et ferociter et libere dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 13, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspere et vehementer loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 227</bibl></cit>: ne quid aspere loquaris, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:31:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 31, 24</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperius loqui aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperius scribere de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperrime loqui in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperrime pati aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:37:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperrime saevire in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3964" type="main" key="Asper2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Asper</orth>, <itype>eri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n3964.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cognomen of L. Trebonius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Trebonius ... insectandis patribus, unde Aspero etiam inditum est cognomen, tribunatum gessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 65, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n3964.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Asper</orth>, <itype>Aspri</itype> (Prob. p. 201 Keil), <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Latin grammarian</hi>, two of whose treatises have come down to us; v. Teuffel, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 474, 4.</sense></entryFree>
asperatus: <entryFree id="n3965" type="main" key="aspe^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. aspero.</entryFree>
aspere: <entryFree id="n3966" type="main" key="aspe^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspĕrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. asper <sense id="n3966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
aspergo: <entryFree id="n3967" type="main" key="aspergo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-spergo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adsp-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl</itype>, Jan; <orth extent="full" lang="la">asp-</orth>, others; in MSS. sometimes <orth extent="full" lang="la">aspar-go</orth>, v. Cort. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 384</bibl>, and Wagner ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 419</bibl>, and infra examples from Lucr. and Hor.; cf. 2. aspergo), <itype>ersi, ersum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>spargo</etym>. <sense id="n3967.0" n="I" level="1"> Aliquid (alicui rei), <hi rend="ital">to scatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strew something on something;</hi> or of liquids, <hi rend="ital">to sprinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spatter over</hi> (syn.: adfundo, inicio; never in Ovid, but he often uses the simple spargo). </sense><sense id="n3967.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor Ionium glaucis aspargit virus ab undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 719</bibl></cit> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ah! adspersisti aquam, Jam rediit animus,</quote> <trans><tr>you have dashed water on me</tr>, <tr>have revived me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euax, adspersisti aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttam bulbo (with a play upon the names Gutta and Bulbus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigmenta in tabulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus ejus adustum adspergunt aliis carnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 38, 57, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquor adspersus oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 8, 18, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bubus glandem tum adspergi convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 26, 63, § 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus floribus aspersis veneratus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecori virus aspergere,</quote> <trans><tr>to infect</tr>, <tr>poison</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspergens cinerem capiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc tu jussos asperge sapores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Non nihil aspersis gaudet Amor lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:12:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 12, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem aspergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:29:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 29, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:43:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Eccli. 43, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3967.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum clarissimo viro non nullam laudatione tuā labeculam aspergas,</quote> <trans><tr>fasten upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qua ex tuā summā indignitate labes illius dignitati aspersa videatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:14:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 14, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">allinere notam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>).—So of an inheritance, <hi rend="ital">to bestow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bequeath</hi> something <hi rend="ital">to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set apart for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aebutio sextulam aspergit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alas: lacteus extentas aspergit circulus alas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 175</bibl></cit>.—In gen., <hi rend="ital">to add to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to join</hi>, = adjungere: <cit><quote lang="la">si illius (sc. Catonis majoris) comitatem et facilitatem tuae gravitati severitatique asperseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic generi orationis aspergentur etiam sales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 26, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos aspersi, ut scires etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3967.3" n="II" level="1"> Aliquem or aliquid aliquā re (cf. Ramsh. Gr. p. 362; Zumpt, Gr. § 418), <hi rend="ital">to strew some person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing with something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to splash over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besprinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bespatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bedew</hi>, lit. and trop. </sense><sense id="n3967.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ah, guttulā Pectus ardens mihi adspersisti (cf. supra, aquam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (sedes) nec nubila nimbis Aspergunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aram sanguine aspergeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:36:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 36, 88</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 9</bibl>, <pb n="175" /> <cb n="ASPE" /> 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:19:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 19, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine mensas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 40</bibl></cit>; and with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperget de sanguine ejus (turturis) parietem altaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaccam semine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vinxit et aspersas altera vitta comas,</quote> <trans><tr>the sprinkled hair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:11:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 11, 34</bibl></cit> (Müller, † <hi rend="ital">acceptas</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">imbre lutoque Aspersus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 12</bibl></cit> K. and H.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 494</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 8, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Macc. 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hyssopo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:50:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Psa. 50, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:25:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jer. 25, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Macc. 10, 25</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n3967.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Mons Idae) primo parvis urbibus aspersus erat,</quote> <trans><tr>dotted over with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures gemitu,</quote> <trans><tr>to fill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">auditiunculā quādam aspersus, i. e. imbutus,</quote> <trans><tr>instructed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:19:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspersi corda a conscientiā malā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 10, 22</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to spot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">asperse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc tu vitae splendorem maculis aspergis istis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 12, 30</bibl></cit>; so also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leviter aspersus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius facti non modo suspitione, sed ne infamiā quidem est aspersus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspergebatur etiam infamiā, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 3</bibl>: aliquem linguā, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 49, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e quibus unus amet quāvis aspargere cunctos, i. e. quibusvis dicteriis perstringere, laedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 87</bibl></cit> K. and H.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3968" type="main" key="aspergo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspergo</orth> (Merk., Müller, Strüb.; in MSS. sometimes <orth extent="full" lang="la">aspargo</orth>, Lachm., Rib., e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 534</bibl>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 405, 5</bibl>, and Vel. Long. p. 2234 P.; v. 1. aspergo), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (in the ante-class. per. <gen>com.</gen> acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 658</bibl> P.) [1. aspergo]. <sense id="n3968.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sprinkling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besprinkling</hi> (most freq. in the poets, never in Cic., who uses aspersio, q. v.): <cit><quote lang="la">aspergo aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 102, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Peneus) Nubila conducit, summasque aspergine silvas Impluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis virides aspergine tinxerat herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 86</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 683 al.: Aspergine et gelu pruinisque (lapides) rumpuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 48, § 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietum,</quote> <trans><tr>the moisture</tr>, <tr>sweat</tr>, <tr>upon walls</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 128</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 11, 1</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 30, § 63</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni culparum aspergine liber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 1005</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3968.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. for concr.), <hi rend="ital">that which is sprinkled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drops</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ubi sol radiis .... Adversa fulsit nimborum aspargine contra,</quote> <trans><tr>opposite to the falling rain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 525</bibl></cit> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">Objectae salsā spumant aspargine cautes,</quote> <trans><tr>the spray</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 534</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Flammiferā gemini fumant aspergine postes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:796" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 796</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maduere graves aspergine pennae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:729" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborei fetus aspergine caedis in atram Vertuntur faciem,</quote> <trans><tr>by means of the sprinkled blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 125</bibl></cit> al.</sense></entryFree>
asperitas: <entryFree id="n3969" type="main" key="aspe^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspĕrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>asper</etym>, <sense id="n3969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the quality of</hi> asper, <hi rend="ital">unevenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roughness</hi> (opp. 2. levitas). </sense><sense id="n3969.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxorum asperitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperitas viarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 75:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 75, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustiae locorumque asperitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:21" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 79, § 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">squamarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faucium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 4, 11, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi asperitas seu potius animae,</quote> <trans><tr>hoarseness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 24, 51, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob asperitatem hiemis,</quote> <trans><tr>roughness</tr>, <tr>severity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperitas frigorum abest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densaque cedit Frigoris asperitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:88 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 88 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperitas luti,</quote> <trans><tr>dryness</tr>, <tr>barrenness of the clay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of raised work (cf. 1. asper, I., and exaspero): <cit><quote lang="la">vasa anaglypta in asperitatemque excisa,</quote> <trans><tr>with figures in basrelief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 49, § 139</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3969.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3969.3" n="1" level="3"> Of taste, <hi rend="ital">harshness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharpness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tartness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 19, 24, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 21, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aceti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <trans><tr>the brackish taste of water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:37 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 9, 20, § 37 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3969.4" n="2" level="3"> Of hearing, <hi rend="ital">roughness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harshness of tone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3969.5" n="3" level="3"> Of sight, <hi rend="ital">inequality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aspectus ejus scaenae propter asperitatem eblandiretur omnium visus,</quote> <trans><tr>on account of the contrast of light and shade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercolumniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3969.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3969.7" n="A" level="2"> Of moral qualities, <hi rend="ital">roughness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harshness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierceness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">asperity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis eā asperitate est et immanitate naturae, congressus ut hominum fugiat atque oderit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avunculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:752" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 752</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artibus ingenuis Pectora mollescunt, asperitasque fugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:6:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperitatis et invidiae corrector,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 129</bibl></cit>.—Of a rigid, austere manner of life: quam illorum (Stoicorum) tristitiam atque asperitatem fugiens Panaetius <cb n="ASPE" /> nec acerbitatem sententiarum nec disserendi spinas probavit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:28:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 28, 79</bibl>; cf. 1. asper, II. A.—And of <hi rend="ital">rudeness in external appearance</hi>, opp. to a polished, cultivated bearing: <cit><quote lang="la">asperitas agrestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3969.8" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">adversity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverse of fortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">difficulty</hi> (cf. 1. asper, II. B., and acerbitas): <cit><quote lang="la">in his vel asperitatibus rerum vel angustiis temporis obsequar studiis nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperitas belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 44</bibl></cit>.—Of style, <hi rend="ital">roughness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harshness</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">traxu/ths</foreign> (cf. 1. asper, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">oratio in quā asperitas contentionis oratoris ipsius humanitate conditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:53:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 53, 212</bibl></cit>. judicialis asperitas, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 64</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:14" default="NO">10, 5, 14</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 23</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 526</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
asperiter: <entryFree id="n3970" type="main" key="aspe^ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspĕrĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. asper <sense id="n3970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
asperitudo: <entryFree id="n3971" type="main" key="asperi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asperĭtūdo</orth>, v. aspritudo.</entryFree>
aspernabilis: <entryFree id="n3972" type="main" key="asperna_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspernābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aspernor</etym>, <sense id="n3972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy of contempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despicable</hi> (ante- and postclass.), Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 179, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:11:3" default="NO">16, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:10" default="NO">20, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 203</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspernabilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mor. Manich. 8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mor. Manich. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aspernamentum: <entryFree id="n3973" type="main" key="asperna_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspernāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a despising;</hi> only <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pud. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aspernanter: <entryFree id="n3974" type="main" key="aspernanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspernanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. aspernor <sense id="n3974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
aspernatio: <entryFree id="n3975" type="main" key="asperna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspernātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aspernor</etym>, <sense id="n3975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a despising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disdain</hi> (very rare): rationis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:14:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 14, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: illius, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 22, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aspernator: <entryFree id="n3976" type="hapax" key="asperna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspernātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a despiser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aspernor: <entryFree id="n3977" type="main" key="aspernor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspernor</orth> (wrongly <orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n3977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [for ab-spernor, as as-pello for abpello, as-porto for ab-porto; cf. ab <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; Doed. Syn. II. p. 179, and Vanicek, p. 1182], lit., <hi rend="ital">to cast off</hi> a person or thing (ab se spernari; cf. sperno and spernor); hence, <hi rend="ital">to disdain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spurn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despise</hi> (simply with the accessory idea of aversion = recuso, respuo, reicio, and opp. to appeto, concupisco; on the other hand, contemnere, not to fear, is opp. to metuere, timere; and despicere, not to value a thing, is opp. to revereri; cf. Doed. Syn. cited supra; class.; very freq. in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">more rare in the poets): alicujus familiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 24</bibl></cit> (aspernari = recusare, avertere, non agnoscere, Don.). </sense><sense id="n3977.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustatus id, quod valde dulce est, aspernatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo bonus ... qui vos non oculis fugiat, auribus respuat, animo aspernetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 20</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:20:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 20, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem ut externum aspernari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pace legatos haud aspernatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc (proscriptionem) nisi hoc judicio a vobis reicitis et aspernamini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem appetit, ut bonum: aspernatur dolorem, ut malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:10:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 10, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ut quodam ab hospite conditum oleum pro viridi adpositum, aspernantibus ceteris, solum etiam largius appetisse scribat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si voluptatem aspernari ratione et sapientiā non possemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querimonias alicujus aspernari, contemnere ac neglegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis liberalitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:91 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 91 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diis aspernantibus placamina irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditionem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 41</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 13</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Interea cave sis nos aspernata sepultos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: aspernabantur ceteros, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 18, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud aspernanda precare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 4, 4</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf. as object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa refert vultu non aspernata rogari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:105" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare aspernabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 46</bibl></cit>. —In Cic. once, <hi rend="ital">to turn away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avert</hi> (not from one's self, but from something pertaining to one's self): furorem alicujus atque crudelitatem a suis aris atque templis, Clu. 68 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n3977.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui colore ipso patriam aspernaris,</quote> <trans><tr>deny</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1</bibl></cit>.—!*? <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: qui habet, ultro appetitur; qui est pauper, aspernatur, <hi rend="ital">is held in contempt</hi>, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 792</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">regem ab omnibus aspernari, Auct. B. Afr. 93: aspernata potio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 175</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">aspernanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (qs. from the <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> aspernans, which does not occur), <hi rend="ital">with contempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemptuously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid accipere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 2</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mus. 4:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mus. 4, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> prob. not used. <cb n="ASPI" /></sense></entryFree>
aspero: <entryFree id="n3978" type="main" key="aspe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspĕro</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">aspro</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. 2, 418</bibl>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>asper</etym>, <sense id="n3978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uneven.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3978.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very freq. in the poets and Tac., but not found in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">asserculi asperantur, ne sint advolantibus lubrici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum enim (apes) propter laborem asperantur ac macescunt,</quote> <trans><tr>become rough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum torpent apes, nec caloribus asperantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vinum myrtites) limum dysentericae passionis medicabiliter asperare, i. e. excrementa solidiora reddere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Et glacialis hiemps aquilonibus asperat undas,</quote> <trans><tr>throws into commotion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 285</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:435" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 435</bibl>: Minervae pectus asperare hydris, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">peri\ stef</foreign>. 14, 275.—</sense><sense id="n3978.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to furnish with a rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wounding exterior</hi> (cf. 1. asper, I.): <cit><quote lang="la">sagittas inopiā ferri ossibus asperant,</quote> <trans><tr>to point</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 46</bibl></cit>.—Hence, also, <hi rend="ital">to whet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sharpen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugionem vetustate obtusum asperari saxo jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abruptaque saxa asperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:801" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 801</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 139</bibl>: nisi cautibus asper Exarsit mucro, and exaspero).—</sense><sense id="n3978.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rouse up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exasperate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indomitos praeceps discordia fratres asperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:137" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc quoque asperavere carmina in saevitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 72 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi asperatum Vitellium satis patuit iis, qui etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne lenire neve asperare crimina videretur,</quote> <trans><tr>to make more severe</tr>, <tr>to aggravate</tr>, <tr>heighten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram victoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aspersio: <entryFree id="n3979" type="main" key="aspersi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspersĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>aspergo</etym>, <sense id="n3979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sprinkling upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sprinkling</hi>. </sense><sense id="n3979.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspersione aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis aspersio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 12, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1</bibl> Pet. 1, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">pulveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:20:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 3 Reg. 20, 28</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the laying on of colors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspersio fortuita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3979.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sint in aquam aspersionis,</quote> <trans><tr>for a water of scattering</tr>, <tr>separation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 19, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aspersus: <entryFree id="n3980" type="main" key="aspersus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspersus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adsp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of aspergo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n3981" type="main" key="aspersus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspersus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adsp-</orth>, Jan), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>aspergo</etym>, <sense id="n3981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sprinkling upon</hi> (used only in the <case>abl.</case>, and perh. only in Plin.): <cit><quote lang="la">calidae aquae adspersu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 37, 56, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insecta olei adspersu necantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 53, 115, § 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aceti adspersu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:82 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 12, 26, § 82 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
asperugo: <entryFree id="n3982" type="main" key="aspe^ru_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspĕrūgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>asper</etym>, <sense id="n3982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant with prickly leaves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asperugo procumbens, Linn.: similis (lappaginis), sed asperioribus foliis asperugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 65, § 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
asphaltion: <entryFree id="n3983" type="greek" key="asphalti^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asphaltĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)sfa/ltion</foreign>, <sense id="n3983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of clover with long leaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and of the odor of asphaltum;</hi> among the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">minu/anqes</foreign>, prob. <hi rend="ital">the common bituminous clover</hi>: Psoralea bituminosa, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 30, § 54</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 2</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
asphaltites: <entryFree id="n3984" type="main" key="Asphalti_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Asphaltītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)asfalti/ths</foreign>; also Asphaltites lacus, = <foreign lang="greek">*)asfalti=tis li/mnh</foreign>, <sense id="n3984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Lake Asphaltites</hi> (<hi rend="ital">the Dead Sea</hi>), <hi rend="ital">in Palestine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 15, 15, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 16, 15, § 72</bibl>; cf. Mann. Palaest. p. 261.</sense></entryFree>
asphodelus: <entryFree id="n3985" type="greek" key="aspho^de^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asphŏdĕlus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭlus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 37, 2</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)sfo/delos</foreign>, <sense id="n3985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the asphodel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of lily-shaped plant with many tubercles at the root</hi>: Asphodelus ramosus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 68, § 108</bibl> sqq. (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 9, 84</bibl>, in pure Lat., albutium).</sense></entryFree>
aspicio: <entryFree id="n3986" type="main" key="aspi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-spĭcĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adsp-</orth>, Jan; <orth extent="full" lang="la">asp-</orth>, <itype>others except Halm</itype>, who uses both), <itype>spexi, spectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (aspexit = aspexerit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 25</bibl>), <sense id="n3986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to behold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">see.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3986.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, constr. in the ante - class. per. sometimes with <hi rend="ital">ad;</hi> but afterwards with the <case>acc.</case>, with a <hi rend="ital">finite clause</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> in eccl. Lat., with <hi rend="ital">in with acc.</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">super with acc.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3986.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspice ad me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspicient ad me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspicere ad terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aspice nunc ad sinisteram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit> (Ritschl, <hi rend="ital">spice</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">ad Scrofam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. the epitaph of Pacuvius: Adulescens, tametsi properas, te hoc saxum rogat, Ut se[se] aspicias, etc., ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—（<foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: Aspice hoc sublimen candens, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:25:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 25, 65</bibl>: templum Cereris, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:2:82" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 2, 82</bibl>: me, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 470, 20</bibl>: aspicite (me) religatum asperis Vinctumque saxis, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 10, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me huc aspice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—In Plaut. twice with <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: aspiciam aliquem <pb n="176" /> <cb n="ASPI" /> contra oculis, Cas. 5, 3, 2: <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Aspicedum contra me. <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Aspexi. <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Vides? <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Video, Most. 5, 1, 56; so, <cit><quote lang="la">non audebat aspicere contra Deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam alicujus aspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergum alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 33, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspicite ipsum: contuemini os, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic obstupuerant, sic terram intuebantur, sic furtim non numquam inter se aspiciebant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspicis me iratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis omnino aspiciendi potestatem eripere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nemo eorum forum aut publicum aspicere vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid rectis oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aspicit hanc torvis (oculis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspiciunt oculis Superi mortalia justis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid oculis aequis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 372</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspice vultus Ecce meos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:92 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 92 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrendae aspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspice nos hoc tantum,</quote> <trans><tr>look on us thus much only</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 690</bibl></cit> Wagner: Aspice Felicem sibi non tibi, Romule, Sullam, poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 59</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">unde aliqua pars aspici potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis procul et arma adspiciebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">super triginta milia armatorum aspiciebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Septentrionem ibi adnotatum primā tantum parte noctis adspici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 73, 75, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi eum aspici nefas esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 5, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adspici humana exta nefas habetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3986.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vide amabo, si non, quom aspicias, os inpudens videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam aspexi, ilico Cognovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3986.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in with acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terram aspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:101:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 101, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Isa. 5, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Matt. 14, 9</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">super with acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">super castra aspicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 9, 7 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3986.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3986.6" n="1. a." level="1"> Of things in space, <hi rend="ital">to look toward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie toward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulatum aspiciat meridiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cryptoporticus non aspicere vineas, sed tangere videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea pars Britanniae, quae Hiberniam aspicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra umidior quā Gallias, ventosior quā Noricum aspicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3986.7" n="b" level="4"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilissimi totius Britanniae eoque in ipsis penetralibus siti nec servientium litora aspicientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3986.8" n="2" level="3"> With the access. idea of purpose (cf.: adeo, aggredior, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to look upon something in order to consider</hi> or <hi rend="ital">examine it;</hi> and in gen. <hi rend="ital">to consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">survey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspect</hi> (freq. in Liv.): <cit><quote lang="la">hujus ut aspicerent opus admirabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boeotiam atque Euboeam aspicere jussi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Boeotiā aspiciendae res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ap. Claudium legatum ad eas res aspiciendas componendasque senatus misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 5 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n3986.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n3986.10" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: sic in oratione Crassi divitias atque ornamenta ejus ingenii per quaedam involucra perspexi; <cit><quote lang="la">sed ea cum contemplari cuperem, vix aspiciendi potestas fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic evolavit oratio, ut ejus vim atque incitationem aspexerim, vestigia ingressumque vix viderim,</quote> <trans><tr>observed</tr>, <tr>noticed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in auctorem fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in remunerationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 11, 26</bibl></cit>.—So esp., <hi rend="ital">to examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflect upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponder</hi> (most freq. in the <hi rend="ital">imperat.</hi>: aspice, <hi rend="ital">see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, etc.). </sense><sense id="n3986.11" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Postea [tu] aspicito meum, quando ego tuum inspectavero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tanta (est) in rebus obscuritas, ut eas non penitus vir ingenio cernat, si modo (eas) aspexerit,</quote> <trans><tr>attends to them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 124</bibl></cit>: aspice, ait, Perseu, nostrae primordia gentis, Ov M. 5, 190.—</sense><sense id="n3986.12" n="b" level="4"> With a <hi rend="ital">finite clause.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3986.13" n="(a)" level="5"> In the <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui semel aspexit, quantum dimissa petitis Praestent, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>has weighed</tr>, <tr>considered</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspiciebant, quomodo turba jactaret aes etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:12:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspiciebant, ubi (Jesus) poneretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 15, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quin tu illam aspice, ut placide adcubat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin aspice, quantum Aggrediare nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aspice, venturo laetentur ut omnia saeclo!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aspice, Plautus Quo pacto partes tutetur amantis ephebi, ut patris attenti ... Quantus sit dossennus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 170</bibl></cit> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">Aspice, num mage sit nostrum penetrabile telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspice, si quid loquamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 4 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aspice, qui coeant populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 385</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Qualem commendes, etiam atque etiam aspice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 76</bibl></cit>: aspice, Quanto cum fastu, quanto molimine circumspectemus<cb n="ASPI" />  etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3986.14" n="(b)" level="5"> In the <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Aspice, ut antrum Silvestris raris sparsit labrusca racemis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aspice, ut insignis spoliis Marcellus opimis Ingreditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:855" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 855</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantas ostentant, aspice, vires,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 771</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aspice, quem gloria extulerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cat. 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspicite, quae fecit nobiscum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 13, 6</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">to take into consideration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have in view</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si genus aspicitur, Saturnum prima parentem Feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3986.15" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n3986.16" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To look upon with respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admiration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat in classe Chabrias privatus, sed eum magis milites quam qui praeerant, aspiciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n3986.17" n="2" level="3"> Aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to look one boldly in the face</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to meet his glance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacedaemonii, quos nemo Boeotiorum ausus fuit aspicere in acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 8, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. supra, I., the passage from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl>). —</sense><sense id="n3986.18" n="3" level="3"> Lumen aspicere, <hi rend="ital">to see the light</hi> for <hi rend="ital">to live</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odi celebritatem, fugio homines, lucem aspicere vix possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 3, 12</bibl>; cf. the foll. number <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n3986.19" n="4" level="3"> Ad inchoative (as in addubito, addormio, aduro, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to get a sight of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perii, si me aspexerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte unam aspicio adulescentulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">respexit et equum alacrem laetus aspexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 73</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum vero Phaëthon cunctis e partibus orbem Aspicit accensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 228</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 651</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspicit hanc visamque vocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:443" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 443</bibl></cit>; 2, 714; 3, 69; 3, 356; 3, 486; 7, 384; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 791 et saep.: Quem simul aspexit scabrum intonsumque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 90</bibl></cit>.—Hence trop.: lumen aspicere, <hi rend="ital">to see the light</hi> for <hi rend="ital">to be born</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut propter quos hanc suavissimam lucem aspexerit, eos indignissime luce privārit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. supra, II. B. 3.</sense></entryFree>
aspilates: <entryFree id="n3987" type="greek" key="aspi_la^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspīlătes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)spila/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n3987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 146</bibl>, where Jan reads <hi rend="ital">aspisatis.</hi></sense></entryFree>
aspiramen: <entryFree id="n3988" type="hapax" key="aspi_ra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspīrāmen</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adsp-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>aspiro</etym>, <sense id="n3988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breathing;</hi> hence <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a communicating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:465" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 465</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aspiratio: <entryFree id="n3989" type="main" key="aspi_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspīrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adsp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n3989.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n3989.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a blowing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breathing to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>: animantes adspiratione aëris sustinentur, <hi rend="ital">by the blowing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breathing of the air</hi> (not <hi rend="ital">by respiration</hi>, as it is commonly rendered), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3989.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">superni numinis,</quote> <trans><tr>favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n3989.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n3989.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Evaporation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhalation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae omnia fiunt et ex caeli varietate et ex disparili adspiratione terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 57, 130</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3989.5" n="B" level="2"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">the enunciation of a word with an</hi> h <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a breathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aspiration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita majores locutos esse, ut nusquam nisi in vocali aspiratione uterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aspirationem apud nos potest quaeri, an in scripto sit vitium, si h littera est, non nota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:9" default="NO">1, 4, 9</bibl> Spald.; 1, 6, 21; 6, 3, 55 al.; cf. Apul. de Nota Aspirat. Osann.—Hence meton., <hi rend="ital">the aspirate</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">the letter</hi> H <hi rend="ital">itself</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 547</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1038 al.</bibl>; Phoc. Aspir. p. 1721 sq. P.</sense></entryFree>
aspiro: <entryFree id="n3990" type="main" key="aspi_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-spīro</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">adsp-</orth>, <itype>Baiter</itype>, Rib., Merk., K. and H.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">asp-</orth>, <itype>Kayser, Halm</itype>, Müller), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n3990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3990.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3990.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To breathe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blow upon;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, the <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quae (granaria) nulla aura umida ex propinquis locis adspiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne ad eum frigus adspiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmones se contrahunt adspirantes,</quote> <trans><tr>exhaling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lenius aspirans aură,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amaracus illum Floribus et dulci adspirans complectitur umbrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 694</bibl></cit>: adspirant aurae in noctem, <hi rend="ital">rise at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">toward night</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si minuma adspirat aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 43, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibia adspirat choro,</quote> <trans><tr>accompanies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:204 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 204 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n3990.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: alicui, <hi rend="ital">to be favorable to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assist</hi> (the figure taken from a fair breeze): <cit><quote lang="la">aspira mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus aspirabat Amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adspirat primo fortuna labori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 385</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adspirate canenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 525</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di, coeptis adspirate meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: magno se praedicat auxilio fuisse, quia paululum in rebus difficillimis aspiravit, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 34</bibl> (cf. afflo).—</sense><sense id="n3990.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To aspire to</hi> a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to desire to reach</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to approach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come near</hi> (esp. with the access. idea of striving to attain to); constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in with acc.</hi>, the <case>dat.</case>, a <hi rend="ital">local adv.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> <cb n="ASSA" /> (class.; freq. in Cic.): qui prope ad ostium adspiraverint, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 4, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim quisquam ad meam pecuniam me invito aspirat? quid accedit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu ad eum Ciceronem numquam aspirasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes aditus tuos interclusi, ut ad me adspirare non posses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspirare in curiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in campum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 18, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne non modo intrare, verum etiam adspicere aut aspirare possim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec equis adspirat Achillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed non incendia Colchis adspirare sinit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:584" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 584</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec ad eam laudem, quam volumus, aspirare non possunt,</quote> <trans><tr>arrive at</tr>, <tr>attain to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:41:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 41, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellicā laude aspirare ad Africanum nemo potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec etiam in equuleum coniciuntur, quo vita non adspirat beata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:3:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3990.5" n="C" level="2"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">to give the</hi> h <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to aspirate</hi> (cf. aspiratio, II.
