B.): <cit><quote lang="la">consonantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci aspirare solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:6:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 6, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3990.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n3990.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To breathe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blow upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to infuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instil;</hi> lit. and trop. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Juno ventos adspirat eunti,</quote> <trans><tr>sends favoring winds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adspiravit auram quandam salutis fortuna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictis divinum amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novam pectoribus fidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Fesc. 14, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis tantum ingenii aspiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 5.— * </sense><sense id="n3990.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To breathe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blow upon;</hi> trop. of the sea, <hi rend="ital">to wash</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula adspiratur freto Gallico,</quote> <trans><tr>is washed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aspis: <entryFree id="n3991" type="greek" key="aspis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<case>acc.</case> Gr. aspida, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 701</bibl>; <number>plur.</number> aspidas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 19, 47</bibl>) [<foreign lang="greek">a)spi/s</foreign>, com. shield, rarely an asp; this order of frequency is reversed in Lat.]. <sense id="n3991.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The asp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">viper</hi>: Coluber, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 18, § 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspide ad corpus admoto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si scieris aspidem occulte latere uspiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 18, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 4, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n3991.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A shield</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)spi/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Nov. 85" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Nov. 85 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
aspisatis: <entryFree id="n3992" type="main" key="aspi_sa^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">aspīsătis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. aspilates.</entryFree>
asplenum: <entryFree id="n3993" type="greek" key="asple_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asplēnum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/splhnon</foreign>, <sense id="n3993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">miltwort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spleenwort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asplenum ceterach, Linn.: Asplenon sunt qui hemionion vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 5, 17, § 34</bibl></cit>; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 4</bibl>, written as Greek, and in <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 9, 87</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">asplenos.</hi></sense></entryFree>
asportatio: <entryFree id="n3994" type="hapax" key="asporta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asportātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>asporto</etym>, <sense id="n3994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
asporto: <entryFree id="n3995" type="main" key="asporto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-porto</orth> <etym>abs-porto; cf. ab <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n3995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">take off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi> (in the class. per. only in prose; cf. Wagner ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:778" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 778</bibl>).—Com., </sense><sense id="n3995.1" n="a" level="4"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum e signo Cereris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 9, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa de suis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua omnia Salamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 12, 30</bibl>.—Also, </sense><sense id="n3995.2" n="b" level="4"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to carry away</hi> (esp. by ship) <hi rend="ital">to transport</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem trans mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 67</bibl></cit>: quoquo hinc asportabitur terrarum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asportate ossa mea vobiscum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:50:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 50, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Dan. 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aspratilis: <entryFree id="n3996" type="main" key="aspra_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asprātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>asper</etym>, <sense id="n3996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rough</hi> (late Lat. for asper): <cit><quote lang="la">piscis,</quote> <trans><tr>with rough scales</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Edict. Diocl. p. 15: terminus, of a rough, unpolished stone, Auct. Lim. p. 305 Goes.: petra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 228.</sense></entryFree>
aspredo: <entryFree id="n3997" type="hapax" key="aspre_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asprēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">roughness;</hi> only in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 2</bibl> Daremb.</sense></entryFree>
aspretum: <entryFree id="n3998" type="main" key="aspre_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asprētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an uneven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hoc saxa erant temere jacentia, ut fit in aspretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:28" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 28</bibl>; 36, 15; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 241</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aspritudo: <entryFree id="n3999" type="main" key="aspri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asprĭtūdo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">asperĭtūdo</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 103, 20</bibl>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n3999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">roughness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo circa totum corpus partemve aspritudo quaedam fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspritudo oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 6, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 7, 15</bibl> Daremb. al.</sense></entryFree>
aspuo: <entryFree id="n4000" type="hapax" key="aspu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">a-spŭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">adsp-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spit at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a nutrice adspui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assa: <entryFree id="n4001" type="main" key="assa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assa</orth>, v. assus, a, um.</entryFree>
assabinus: <entryFree id="n4002" type="main" key="Assabinus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Assabinus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n4002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deity of the Ethiopians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assaracus: <entryFree id="n4003" type="main" key="Assa^ra^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Assărăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)assa/rakos</foreign>, <sense id="n4003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">King of Phrygia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Tros</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Ganymede and Ilus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Capys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and grandfather of Anchises</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:756" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 756</bibl>.—Hence, <pb n="177" /> <cb n="ASSE" /> Assaraci nurus, <hi rend="ital">Venus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:123" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 123</bibl>: Assaraci Frater, <hi rend="ital">Ganymede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Aquarius</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:943" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 943</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Assaraci gens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Romans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 643</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assarius: <entryFree id="n4004" type="hapax" key="assa_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>asso</etym>, <sense id="n4004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">roasted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">daps pecuina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 132, 2</bibl></cit> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4005" type="main" key="assa_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. as <sense id="n4005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
assatura: <entryFree id="n4006" type="main" key="assa_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>asso</etym>, <sense id="n4006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">roasted meat</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:5" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 5</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 6, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assecla: <entryFree id="n4007" type="main" key="asse^cla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĕcla</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, B. and K., Jahn; <orth extent="full" lang="la">ass-</orth>, Halm), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 37</bibl> P. (but examples are found only in <sense id="n4007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>) [assequor], <hi rend="ital">a follower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an attendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sycophant</hi> (with the accessory idea of contempt, different from assectator; cf. Ruhnk. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:83" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 83</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">assentatores eorum atque adseculae, Cic. Corn. Fragm. ap. Orell. IV. 2, p. 453: legatorum adseculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:Verr. 2:1:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum adseculae suo tetrarchian dedisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:Div. 2:37:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 37, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:Sest. 64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sest. 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Orell. (ed. min.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:Att. 6:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">assecla praetoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adseculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:48" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 48</bibl></cit> dub. Jahn.</sense></entryFree>
assectatio: <entryFree id="n4008" type="main" key="assecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assectātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>assector</etym>. <sense id="n4008.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An</hi> (<hi rend="ital">assiduous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respectful</hi>) <hi rend="ital">attendance</hi> (as that of clients, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">in petitionibus opera atque adsectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 34</bibl></cit>: so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 9" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4008.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Observation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">study</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna caeli adsectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 20, 18, § 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assectator: <entryFree id="n4009" type="main" key="assecta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assectātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that is in attendance upon</hi> any one (<hi rend="ital">as friend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">client</hi>, etc.), <hi rend="ital">a follower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an attendant</hi> (in a good sense, while assecla is used in a contemptuous sense). </sense><sense id="n4009.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus adsectator ex numero amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum comitatu adsectatoribusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: hujus autem rei (sc. adsectationis) tres partes sunt: una salutatorum, cum domum veniunt; <cit><quote lang="la">altera deductorum, tertia adsectatorum,</quote> <trans><tr>who are always in attendance upon the candidates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 9 al" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 9 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cancer dapis adsectator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 42, 66, § 142</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4009.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a disciple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae, i. e. philosophus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 17, 21, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 14, 57, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditor adsectatorque Protagorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assector: <entryFree id="n4010" type="main" key="assector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sector</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, <itype>Kayser, Halm</itype>, K. and H.), ātus, 1, <sense id="n4010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4010.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To attend</hi> one <hi rend="ital">with zeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eagerness</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to accompany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wait upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be in attendance upon</hi> (esp. of the friends of candidates for office): cum aedilitatem P. Crassus peteret, eumque major natu, etiam consularis, Ser. Galba adsectaretur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 239</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia adulescentulorum in suffragando, in adsectando mirifice et magna et honesta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 8" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum adsectaretur: Num quid vis? occupo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis inferioris Germaniae miles Valentem adsectabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 93 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum celebritatem adsectarentur adulescentium scholae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 54, § 152</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4010.2" n="II" level="1"> In jurid. Lat.: feminam, <hi rend="ital">to follow a woman</hi> (considered as a wrong), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:15:section=22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 15, § 22</bibl>.!*? <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: adsectari se omnes cupiunt: adsectari passive, <foreign lang="greek">a)kolouqei=sqai</foreign>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 792</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
assecutor: <entryFree id="n4011" type="hapax" key="asse^cu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĕcūtor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>assequor</etym>, <sense id="n4011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an attendant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cupidinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, p. 306</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assedo: <entryFree id="n4012" type="gloss" key="asse^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĕdo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = assessor, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 63, 23</bibl>.</entryFree>
assefolium: <entryFree id="n4013" type="main" key="asse^fo^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĕfŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n4013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant;</hi> also called, after the Gr., agrostis, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assellor: <entryFree id="n4014" type="main" key="assellor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sellor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>sella</etym>, <sense id="n4014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go to stool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to void</hi> (perh. only in Veg.): <cit><quote lang="la">multum stercoris assellatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 22, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 44, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 56, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assenesco: <entryFree id="n4015" type="main" key="asse^nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sĕnesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n4015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become old to</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">Cereri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Cast. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assensio: <entryFree id="n4016" type="main" key="assensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sensĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>assentior</etym>, <sense id="n4016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approbation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">applause</hi> (esp. in rhetor. and philos. lang.; <cit><quote lang="la">beyond this sphere assensus is more usu.): orationis genus exile nec satis populari adsensioni accommodatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 30, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:31:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 31, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebrae adsensiones, multae admirationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 84, 290</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 73</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:12:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12, 6 al.</bibl>—In philos. lang., <hi rend="ital">an assent to the reality of sensible appearances</hi>: nunc de adsensione atque adprobatione, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">sugkata/qesin</foreign> vocant, pauca dicemus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 12</bibl>, <cb n="ASSE" /> 37: <cit><quote lang="la">non sunt neque adsensiones neque actiones in nostrā potestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 17</bibl></cit> (v. the context, and <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
assensor: <entryFree id="n4017" type="main" key="assensor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assensor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that assents to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">agrees with</hi> any one: <cit><quote lang="la">cotidie commemorabam te unum in tanto exercitu mihi fuisse adsensorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 21</bibl></cit>; Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 3, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindictae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1207" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1207</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assensus: <entryFree id="n4018" type="main" key="assensus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assensus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of assentior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4019" type="main" key="assensus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assensus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>assentior</etym>, <sense id="n4019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approval</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approbation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4019.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">adsensu omnium dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volgi adsensu et populari approbatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:49:185" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 49, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium adsensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsensu senatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:71" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsensum consequi agendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 7, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 45</bibl> et saep.—In the <number>plur.</number>: dicta Jovis pars voce probant; <cit><quote lang="la">alii partes assensibus implent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 245</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 604</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc ingentes exciri adsensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Also <hi rend="ital">joyful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loud assent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exposuit cum ingenti adsensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4019.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n4019.3" n="A" level="2"> In philos. lang., like assensio, <hi rend="ital">an assent to the reality of sensible appearances</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concedam illum ipsum sapientem ... retenturum adsensum, nec umquam ulli viso adsensurum, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollendus adsensus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 59</bibl></cit>; 2, 18, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:31 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 31 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n4019.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an echo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Et vox adsensu nemorum ingeminata remugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aereaque adsensu conspirant cornua rauco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 615</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 615</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assentatio: <entryFree id="n4020" type="main" key="assenta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assentātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>assentor</etym>. <sense id="n4020.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A flattering assent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flattery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adulation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec illum perdidit adsentatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam in amicitiis pestem esse majorem quam adulationem, blanditiam, adsentationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsentationes, blanditiae et pejor odio amoris simulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:85" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci diuturnā servitute ad nimiam adsentationem eruditi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se blanditiis et adsentationibus in Asinii consuetudinem penitus immersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflatus adsentationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 6 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n4020.1" n="II" level="1"> Rarely in a good sense, <hi rend="ital">approbation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:128" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad neutram partem adsentationem flectere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assentatiuncula: <entryFree id="n4021" type="main" key="assenta_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assentātĭuncŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>assentatio</etym>, <sense id="n4021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">petty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trivial flattery</hi>: adsentatiunculae ac perjuratiunculae parasiticae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 75</bibl>: non vereor, ne adsentatiunculā quādam aucupari tuam gratiam videar, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assentator: <entryFree id="n4022" type="main" key="assenta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assentātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>assentor</etym>, <sense id="n4022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who assents flatteringly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a flatterer</hi> (most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n4022.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper auget adsentator id, quod is, cujus ad voluntatem loquitur, vult esse magnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fit, ut is adsentatoribus patefaciat aures suas maxime, qui ipse sibi adsentetur et se maxime ipse delectet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 14, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 26, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 5, 14</bibl>: Adsentatores jubet ad lucrum ire poëta Dives agris, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 420</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4022.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non auctor, sed adsentator mali,</quote> <trans><tr>one who connives at</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assentatorie: <entryFree id="n4023" type="hapax" key="assenta_to_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assentātōrĭē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a flattering manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fawningly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubitare te, non adsentatorie (i. e. non tibi indulgens), sed fraterne veto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 2, 15, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assentatrix: <entryFree id="n4024" type="hapax" key="assenta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assentātrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>assentator</etym>, <sense id="n4024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female flatterer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsentatrix scelestast,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assentio: <entryFree id="n4025" type="main" key="assenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assentĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), v. assentior.</entryFree>
assentior: <entryFree id="n4026" type="main" key="assenti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sentĭor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, Fleck., B. and K., Halm, Weissenb.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">ass-</orth>, Merk.), <itype>sensus, 4</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>sentio</etym> (the <sense id="n4026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form <orth extent="full" lang="la">assentio</orth>, <itype>īre, was out of use even in the time of Varro</itype>, Varr. L. L. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:25:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 25, 9</bibl>; cf. Spald. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 55</bibl>. The middle use of the word corresponds far better with its signif. than the active; for while adsentio prop. signif. only sentiendo accedere ad aliquem or aliquid, to make known one's inclination or feeling toward any object, whether in favor of or against it; the middle, assentior, = sentiendo se applicare, designates a friendly joining of one's self to any one. The <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form, adsentio, is found in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 36</bibl>; Att. and Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 469, 16 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 130</bibl>; in Cic. only three times in <cb n="ASSE" /> epist. style (which is worthy of notice; cf. absque), Fam. 5, 2, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:9:9" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 9, 9</bibl>; and ad Q. Fr. 2, 1, 2; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 377</bibl> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">but after the time of the poets of the Aug. per. it is often found, particularly in the post-Aug. histt., together with the class. mid. form, used in like manner: assensit precibus Rhamnusia justis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 406</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 259</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 592 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de aliis rebus adsentire se veteribus Gabinis diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Adsensere atque etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:5:5 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 5, 5 al.</bibl>), lit., <hi rend="ital">to join</hi> one <hi rend="ital">in opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to agree with;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to assent to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give assent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to approve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give approval;</hi> with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: adsensus sum homini, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 801</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Adsentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsensi sunt omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:34:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 34, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum saepissime tibi senatus maximis sit de rebus adsensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 214</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ulli rei sapiens adsentietur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 21, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (sententiae) sunt adsensi ad unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (verbis) adsensi sunt in conspectu meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:34:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 34, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Macc. 14, 26</bibl>: in quibus adsentior sollicitam et periculosam justitiam non esse sapientis, Cic. Rep. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 801</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientem, si adsensurus esset, etiam opinaturum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 21, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbo adsentiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes adsensi sunt partibus dividundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 24 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui non adsentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 49</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne adsentiri necesse esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl></cit> et saep.—So of conduct, <hi rend="ital">to yield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam ob rem adsentire nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 13, 20</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">neutr. acc. aliquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cetera</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non habeo autem quid tibi adsentiar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:25:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 25, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiosum est adsentiri quidquam falsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 21, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera adsentior Crasso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mihi quoque adsunt testes, qui illut quod ego dicam adsentiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud quod a te dictum est, valde tibi adsentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 126</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 48, 182</bibl>.!*? <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: is (sapiens) multa sequitur probabilia, non comprehensa neque percepta neque adsensa, sed similia veri, <hi rend="ital">nor assented to as perceived by sense</hi> (cf. assensio and assensus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 99</bibl>.—And <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bibulo adsensum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assentor: <entryFree id="n4027" type="main" key="assentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assentor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>; v. assentior <sense id="n4027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), ātus, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [irreg. for adsensor, from assentior], lit., <hi rend="ital">to join</hi> one <hi rend="ital">in judgment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opinion</hi> (opp. adversor); hence, always <hi rend="ital">to assent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to agree with</hi> one in every thing, <hi rend="ital">to flatter</hi> (in the class. per. only in prose); with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etiam tu quoque adsentaris huice?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">assentatrix: (callidus adulator) etiam adversando saepe adsentetur et litigare se simulans blandiatur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:48" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi adsentabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Negat quis? nego: ait? aio. Postremo imperavi egomet mihi, Omnia adsentari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fuit, ut is adsentatoribus patefaciat aures suas maxime, qui ipse sibi adsentetur et se maxime delectet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nihil nobis adsentati esse videamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia mihi ipse adsentor fortasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: Baiae tibi assentantur, <hi rend="ital">flatters you</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">endeavors to ingratiate itself into your favor by its sanative powers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsentante majore convivarum parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui ergo consilio adsentabimur?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Cast. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assequela: <entryFree id="n4028" type="hapax" key="asse^que_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assĕquēla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>assequor</etym>, <sense id="n4028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a succeeding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succession</hi>, Mar. Vict. p. 2500 P.</sense></entryFree>
assequor: <entryFree id="n4029" type="main" key="asse^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sĕquor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, Fleck., B. and K., Halm), sĕcūtus (or sĕquutus; v. sequor), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n4029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to follow</hi> one in order to come <hi rend="ital">up to</hi> him, <hi rend="ital">to pursue.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4029.1" n="I. A." level="1"> In gen. (only ante-class. in the two foll. exs.): ne sequere, adsequere, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=73" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 73</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Adsequere, retine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 89</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n4029.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to reach</hi> one <hi rend="ital">by pursuing</hi> him: <cit><quote lang="la">sequendo pervenire ad aliquem: nec quicquam sequi, quod adsequi non queas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 110</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">to overtake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come up with</hi> a person or thing (with the idea of active exertion; while consequi designates merely a coming up with, a meeting with a desired object, the attainment of a wish; cf. Doed. Syn. III. p. 147 sq. According to gen. usage, adsequor is found only in prose; <cit><quote lang="la">but consequor is freq. found in the poets): si es Romae jam me adsequi non potes, sin es in viā, cum eris me adsecutus, coram agemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <pb n="178" /> <cb n="ASSE" /> poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pisonem nuntius adsequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 75</bibl></cit>.—In the histt. also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si viā rectā vestigia sequentes īssent, haud dubie adsecuturi fuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Bruttios raptim, ne Gracchus adsequeretur, concessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum adsecutā parte suorum,</quote> <trans><tr>arrived</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4029.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n4029.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eosdem honorum gradus adsecuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immortalitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 37, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes magistratus sine repulsā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil quicquam egregium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:30:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 30, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā in re nihil aliud adsequeris, nisi ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsecutas virtute, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4029.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To attain to one</hi> in any quality, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to come up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to equal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">match;</hi> more freq. in regard to the quality itself, <hi rend="ital">to attain to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sisenna Clitarchum velle imitari videtur: quem si adsequi posset, aliquantum ab optimo tamen abesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentiam tuam erga me imitabor, merita non adsequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui illorum prudentiam, non dicam adsequi, sed quanta fuerit perspicere possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium alicujus aliquā ex parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: ut longitudo aut plenitudo harum multitudinem alterius adsequatur et exaequet, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4029.6" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to mental objects, <hi rend="ital">to attain to by an effort of the under standing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to comprehend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut essent, qui cogitationem adsequi possent et voluntatem interpretari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:47:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 47, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (ratione et intellegentiā) utimur ad eam rem, ut apertis obscura adsequamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:15:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut scribas ad me, quid ipse conjecturā adsequare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 13</bibl></cit> A <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quis tot ludibria fortunae ... aut animo adsequi queat aut oratione complecti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 10</bibl></cit>; Sex. Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid istuc sit, videor ferme adsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visum est et mihi adsecuto omnia a principio diligenter ex ordine tibi scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsecutus es meam doctrinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Tim. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Tim. 4, 6</bibl>.!*? <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 791</bibl> P., but without an example; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 73 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, instead of the earlier reading, it is better to read, ut haec diligentia nihil eorum investigare, nihil adsequi potuerit; cf. Zumpt ad h. l., and Gronov. Observ. 1, 12, 107; so also B. and K.</sense></entryFree>
asser: <entryFree id="n4030" type="main" key="asser"><orth extent="full" lang="la">asser</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from 2. assero, quod admoveantur haereantque parietibus, Perot.; so agger from aggero</etym>. <sense id="n4030.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A beam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Co.</hi> Sunt asseres? <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Sunt pol, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 6, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asseres pedum XII., cuspidibus praefixi in terră defigebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 30</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:29:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 29, 29 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n4030.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pole on which a litter was borne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:245" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 245</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:132" default="NO">7, 132</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4030.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
asserculus: <entryFree id="n4031" type="main" key="assercu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assercŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">assercŭ-lum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Cato) [asser] <sense id="n4031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small beam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pole</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:6" default="NO">8, 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assero: <entryFree id="n4032" type="main" key="asse^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sĕro</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, K. and H., Müller), <itype>sēvi, situm, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plant</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">set near</hi> something (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.), Agroet. de Orthogr. p. 2274 P.: vites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis adsita ad olus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites propter cupressos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: Lenta quin velut adsitas Vitis implicat arbores, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 102</bibl>: populus adsita certis Limitibus, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 170</bibl> (quippe quae vitibus maritaretur, Agroet. l. c.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n4033" type="main" key="asse^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-sĕro</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, <itype>Ritschl, Fleckeisen</itype>, Merk., Halm, Weissenb.), <itype>sĕrŭi, sertum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to join</hi> some person or thing <hi rend="ital">to</hi> one's self; hence, </sense><sense id="n4033.1" n="I" level="1"> As a jurid. t. t. (so this word is most freq. found; cf. assertor and assertio). </sense><sense id="n4033.2" n="A" level="2"> Aliquem manu, in libertatem or liberali causā (also merely manu, and finally <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> adserere), <hi rend="ital">to declare one</hi> (a slave) <hi rend="ital">to be free by laying hands upon him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to liberate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adserere manu in libertatem ...,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 64</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in libertatem adserebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se adserit in libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in iis qui adserantur in libertatem, quia quivis lege agere possit, id juris esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 45</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in ingenuitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ingenuitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:14:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu eas adserat Suas populares liberali causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manuque liberali causā ambas adseras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 142</bibl></cit>: si quisquam <cb n="ASSE" /> hanc liberali adseruisset manu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego liberali illam adsero causā manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: cum in causā liberali eum, qui adserebatur cognatum, suum esse diceret, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 17, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem venire, qui istas adsereret manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam a lenone adserito manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 83</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and transf.: pisces manu adserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adserui jam me fugique catenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit> Merk.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n4033.3" n="B" level="2"> Aliquem in servitutem, <hi rend="ital">to declare one to be a slave by laying the hand upon him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to claim as a slave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Claudio clienti negotium dedit (Ap. Claudius), ut virginem in servitutem adsereret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 44</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:16" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 16</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n4033.4" n="II" level="1"> After the poets of the Aug. per., transf. from the judicial sphere to common life. </sense><sense id="n4033.5" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I. A.) <hi rend="ital">To free from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to protect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend against</hi> (esp. freq. in Flor. and Suet.): <cit><quote lang="la">habe ante oculos mortalitatem, a quā adserere te hoc uno munimento potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab injuriā oblivionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberatae Italiae adsertique imperii nuntius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:19" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post adsertam a Manlio, restitutam a Camillo urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 13, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latini quoque Tarquinios adserebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gracchanas leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:16:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">easdem leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:17:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:18:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 18, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:19" default="NO">3, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:17:4" default="NO">3, 17, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 16</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defendere dignitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tueri dignitatem): senatus in adserendā libertate consensit,</quote> <trans><tr>in the restoring of freedom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">namque adserit urbes sola fames (liberas facit urbes contra dominos, Schol.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc focale tuas adserat auriculas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>guard against the hearing of bad verses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:142" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non te cucullis adseret caput tectum (sc. a basiis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 99</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n4033.6" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B.) Aliquid sibi, <hi rend="ital">to appropriate something to one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to claim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare it one's own possession</hi>: nec laudes adsere nostras, <hi rend="ital">claim not for yourself</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 462</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (gaudia) utrāque manu complexuque adsere toto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:16:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 16, 9</bibl></cit>; and (per hypallagen): me adsere caelo, <hi rend="ital">appoint me to the skies</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">declare me to be of celestial origin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:761" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 761</bibl>.—In prose, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:60" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 60</bibl> Runhk.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Unus hominum ad hoc aevi Felicis sibi cognomen adseruit L. Sulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 44, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientis sibi nomen adseruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi artem figurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse te in alto isto pinguique secessu studiis adseris?</quote> <trans><tr>are you devoting yourself?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominationem sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinam majestatem sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallaeci Graecam sibi originem adserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4033.7" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affirm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare;</hi> <foreign lang="greek">diabebaiou=mai</foreign>, Gloss.: <cit><quote lang="la">non haec Colchidos adserit furorem, Diri prandia nec refert Thyestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:35" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicharmus testium malis hanc utilissime imponi adserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 34, § 89</bibl></cit>, where Jan conjectures <hi rend="ital">ait</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollissimum quemque beatum fore adserebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 28:8" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 28, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:ib. 3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vacat adserere quae finxeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 7:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 19, 3</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 25, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
assertio: <entryFree id="n4034" type="main" key="asserti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assertĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. assero</etym>. <sense id="n4034.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (acc. to 2. assero, I. A.), <hi rend="ital">a formal declaration that one is a freeman</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a slave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsertio tam a servitute in libertatem, quam a libertate in servitium trahi significat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1208</bibl></cit> P.; Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 72 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfusoriae adsertiones,</quote> <trans><tr>unauthorized declarations of freedom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitne liber qui est in adsertione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in reis deportatis et adsertione secundā (i. e. judicio secundo, in quo adsertor de libertate agit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; so also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 78</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 17, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n4034.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an assertion</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum adsertio religiosa,</quote> <trans><tr>an assertion of the existence of the gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, p. 141</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assertor: <entryFree id="n4035" type="main" key="assertor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assertor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n4035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who formally asserts that another is free</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a slave.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4035.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A restorer of liberty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n4035.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: adsertores dicuntur vindices alienae libertatis, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 40</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">2. assero, I. A.: populo detrectante dominationem atque adsertores flagitante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catoni gladium adsertorem libertatis extorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4035.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a defender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliverer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advocate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicus adsertor dominis suppressa levabo Pectora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs adsertor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 214</bibl></cit> (qui in libertatem defendis senatum, Schol.); Mart. <cb n="ASSE" /> 1, 53, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">adsertores Camilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatis ac potentiae patriciorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionis,</quote> <trans><tr>he who carries an inquiry entirely through</tr>, <tr>is master of the subject</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n4035.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">He who claims</hi> or <hi rend="ital">declares one to be a slave</hi> (cf. 2. assero, I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum instaret adsertor puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 46</bibl></cit>, and besides only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assertorius: <entryFree id="n4036" type="hapax" key="asserto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assertōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>assertor</etym>, <sense id="n4036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a restoration of freedom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
assertum: <entryFree id="n4037" type="hapax" key="assertum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assertum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. assero, II. C.</etym>, <sense id="n4037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assertion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, p. 195</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
assertus: <entryFree id="n4038" type="main" key="assertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">assertus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of 2. assero.</entryFree>
asservio: <entryFree id="n4039" type="hapax" key="asservi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-servĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>), <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n4039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to serve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentioni vocis adserviunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
asservo: <entryFree id="n4040" type="main" key="asservo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">as-servo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ads-</orth>, Fleck., B. and K., Weissenb., Müller), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n4040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to watch over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi> (<hi rend="ital">carefully</hi>) a person or thing (very freq. of things kept in custody; <cit><quote lang="la">in the class. per. mostly in prose): adservatote haec, sultis, navales pedes (i. e. mercenarii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae neglegentius adservatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora (mortuorum) in conditorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 16, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem in ferulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thynni sale adservantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 15, 18, § 48</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, in sale adservari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 25, 41, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hunc quoque adserva ipsum, ne quo abitat,</quote> <trans><tr>watch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinito ambulare, si foris, si intus volent, Sed uti adserventur magnā diligentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerrime adservabimus,</quote> <trans><tr>we shall very closely watch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portas murosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vinctum te adservet domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura adservandum vinctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperat dum res judicetur, hominem ut adservent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut domi meae te adservarem, rogāsti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vitrubium in carcerem adservari jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:23" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:19" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 19</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 30: sacra fideli custodiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella Adservanda nigerrimis diligentius uvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
